	<h1 id="firstHeading" class="firstHeading" >Neymar</h1>
	<div id="bodyContent" class="mw-body-content">
		<div id="siteSub" class="noprint">From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia</div>
		<div id="contentSub"></div>
		<div id="contentSub2"></div>
		
		<div id="jump-to-nav"></div>
		<a class="mw-jump-link" href="#mw-head">Jump to navigation</a>
		<a class="mw-jump-link" href="#searchInput">Jump to search</a>
		<div id="mw-content-text" lang="en" dir="ltr" class="mw-content-ltr"><div class="mw-parser-output"><p class="mw-empty-elt">
</p>
<div class="shortdescription nomobile noexcerpt noprint searchaux" style="display:none">Brazilian association football player</div>
<p class="mw-empty-elt">

</p>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">This name uses <a href="/wiki/Portuguese_name" title="Portuguese name">Portuguese naming customs</a>: the first or maternal <a href="/wiki/Surname" title="Surname">family name</a> is <i>da Silva</i>&#32;and the second or paternal family name is <i>Santos</i>.</div>
<table class="infobox vcard" style="width:22em;line-height: 1.2em"><caption class="fn" style="line-height: 1.5em; text-align: center;">Neymar</caption><tbody><tr><td colspan="4" style="text-align:center">

</div></div></th></tr><tr><td colspan="4" style="text-align:center;color:darkslategray; font-size:95%">
* Senior club appearances and goals counted for the domestic league only&#32;and correct as of 7 February 2021<br />‡ National team caps and goals correct as of 02:06, 14 October 2020 (UTC)</td></tr></tbody></table>
<p><b>Neymar da Silva Santos Júnior</b> (<span style="font-size:85%;">Brazilian Portuguese:&#160;</span><span title="Representation in the International Phonetic Alphabet (IPA)" class="IPA"><a href="/wiki/Help:IPA/Portuguese" title="Help:IPA/Portuguese">[nejma d siwv stus o]</a></span>; born 5 February 1992), known as <b>Neymar</b>, is a Brazilian professional <a href="/wiki/Association_football" title="Association football">footballer</a> who plays as a <a href="/wiki/Forward_(association_football)" title="Forward (association football)">forward</a> for <a href="/wiki/Ligue_1" title="Ligue 1">Ligue 1</a> club <a href="/wiki/Paris_Saint-Germain_F.C." title="Paris Saint-Germain F.C.">Paris Saint-Germain</a> and the <a href="/wiki/Brazil_national_football_team" title="Brazil national football team">Brazil national team</a>. He is widely regarded as one of the best players in the world.<sup id="cite_ref-7" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-7">&#91;7&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-8" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-8">&#91;8&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Neymar came into prominence at <a href="/wiki/Santos_FC" title="Santos FC">Santos</a>, where he made his professional debut aged 17. He helped the club win two successive <a href="/wiki/Campeonato_Paulista" title="Campeonato Paulista">Campeonato Paulista</a> championships, a <a href="/wiki/Copa_do_Brasil" title="Copa do Brasil">Copa do Brasil</a>, and the <a href="/wiki/2011_Copa_Libertadores" title="2011 Copa Libertadores">2011 Copa Libertadores</a>; the latter being Santos' first since 1963. Neymar was twice named the <a href="/wiki/South_American_Footballer_of_the_Year" title="South American Footballer of the Year">South American Footballer of the Year</a>, in <a href="/wiki/2011_South_American_Footballer_of_the_Year" title="2011 South American Footballer of the Year">2011</a> and <a href="/wiki/2012_South_American_Footballer_of_the_Year" title="2012 South American Footballer of the Year">2012</a>, and soon relocated to Europe to join <a href="/wiki/FC_Barcelona" title="FC Barcelona">Barcelona</a>. As part of Barcelona's attacking trio with <a href="/wiki/Lionel_Messi" title="Lionel Messi">Lionel Messi</a> and <a href="/wiki/Luis_Su%C3%A1rez" title="Luis Suárez">Luis Suárez</a>, he won the <a href="/wiki/Treble_(association_football)" title="Treble (association football)">continental treble</a> of <a href="/wiki/La_Liga" title="La Liga">La Liga</a>, the <a href="/wiki/Copa_del_Rey" title="Copa del Rey">Copa del Rey</a>, and the <a href="/wiki/UEFA_Champions_League" title="UEFA Champions League">UEFA Champions League</a>, and finished third for the <a href="/wiki/FIFA_Ballon_d%27Or" title="FIFA Ballon d&#39;Or">FIFA Ballon d'Or</a> in <a href="/wiki/2015_FIFA_Ballon_d%27Or" title="2015 FIFA Ballon d&#39;Or">2015</a> for his performances. He then attained a <a href="/wiki/Double_(association_football)" title="Double (association football)">domestic double</a> in the <a href="/wiki/2015%E2%80%9316_FC_Barcelona_season" title="2015–16 FC Barcelona season">2015–16 season</a>. In 2017, Neymar transferred to <a href="/wiki/Paris_Saint-Germain_F.C." title="Paris Saint-Germain F.C.">Paris Saint-Germain</a> in a move worth €222&#160;million, making him <a href="/wiki/List_of_most_expensive_association_football_transfers" title="List of most expensive association football transfers">the most expensive player ever</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-11" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-11">&#91;note 1&#93;</a></sup> In France, Neymar won three league titles, two <a href="/wiki/Coupe_de_France" title="Coupe de France">Coupe de France</a>, and two <a href="/wiki/Coupe_de_la_Ligue" title="Coupe de la Ligue">Coupe de la Ligue</a>, which included a domestic treble and being voted <a href="/wiki/Ligue_1_Player_of_the_Year" title="Ligue 1 Player of the Year">Ligue 1 Player of the Year</a> in his debut season.<sup id="cite_ref-12" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-12">&#91;11&#93;</a></sup> Neymar helped PSG attain a domestic <a href="/wiki/List_of_association_football_teams_to_have_won_four_or_more_trophies_in_one_season" title="List of association football teams to have won four or more trophies in one season">quadruple</a> in the <a href="/wiki/2019%E2%80%9320_Paris_Saint-Germain_F.C._season" title="2019–20 Paris Saint-Germain F.C. season">2019–20 season</a>, and led the club to its first ever <a href="/wiki/2020_UEFA_Champions_League_Final" title="2020 UEFA Champions League Final">Champions League Final</a>.
</p><p>With 64 goals in 103 matches for Brazil since debuting at age 18, Neymar is the <a href="/wiki/Brazil_national_football_team#Top_goalscorers" title="Brazil national football team">second highest goalscorer</a> for his national team, trailing only <a href="/wiki/Pel%C3%A9" title="Pelé">Pelé</a>. He was a key player in Brazil's victories at the <a href="/wiki/2011_South_American_Youth_Championship" class="mw-redirect" title="2011 South American Youth Championship">2011 South American Youth Championship</a>, where he finished as leading goalscorer, and the <a href="/wiki/2013_FIFA_Confederations_Cup" title="2013 FIFA Confederations Cup">2013 FIFA Confederations Cup</a>, where he won the <a href="/wiki/Golden_Ball_(FIFA_Confederations_Cup)" class="mw-redirect" title="Golden Ball (FIFA Confederations Cup)">Golden Ball</a> as player of the tournament. His participation in the <a href="/wiki/2014_FIFA_World_Cup" title="2014 FIFA World Cup">2014 FIFA World Cup</a> and <a href="/wiki/2015_Copa_Am%C3%A9rica" title="2015 Copa América">2015 Copa América</a> was cut short by injury and a suspension, respectively, before captaining Brazil to their first Olympic gold medal in <a href="/wiki/Football_at_the_2016_Summer_Olympics_%E2%80%93_Men%27s_tournament" title="Football at the 2016 Summer Olympics – Men&#39;s tournament">men's football</a> at the <a href="/wiki/2016_Summer_Olympics" title="2016 Summer Olympics">2016 Summer Olympics</a>. Two years later, having renounced the captaincy, he featured at the <a href="/wiki/2018_FIFA_World_Cup" title="2018 FIFA World Cup">2018 FIFA World Cup</a>.
</p><p>Off the pitch, Neymar ranks among the world's most prominent sportsmen; <i><a href="/wiki/SportsPro" title="SportsPro">SportsPro</a></i> named him the most marketable athlete in the world in 2012 and 2013, and <a href="/wiki/ESPN" title="ESPN">ESPN</a> cited him as the world's fourth-most famous athlete in 2016. In 2017, Neymar was included by <i><a href="/wiki/Time_(magazine)" title="Time (magazine)">Time</a></i> in its list of the <a href="/wiki/Time_100" title="Time 100">100 most influential people in the world</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-:0_13-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-:0-13">&#91;12&#93;</a></sup> By 2018, <i><a href="/wiki/France_Football" title="France Football">France Football</a></i> ranked Neymar the world's third highest-paid footballer. In 2019, <i><a href="/wiki/Forbes" title="Forbes">Forbes</a></i> ranked him the <a href="/wiki/Forbes%27_list_of_the_world%27s_highest-paid_athletes" title="Forbes&#39; list of the world&#39;s highest-paid athletes">world's third highest-paid athlete</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-Forbes_14-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Forbes-14">&#91;13&#93;</a></sup> and fourth highest-paid in 2020.<sup id="cite_ref-15" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-15">&#91;14&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<div id="toc" class="toc" role="navigation" aria-labelledby="mw-toc-heading"><input type="checkbox" role="button" id="toctogglecheckbox" class="toctogglecheckbox" style="display:none" /><div class="toctitle" lang="en" dir="ltr"><h2 id="mw-toc-heading">Contents</h2><span class="toctogglespan"><label class="toctogglelabel" for="toctogglecheckbox"></label></span></div>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Early_life">Early life</span></h2>
<p>Neymar da Silva Santos Júnior was born in <a href="/wiki/Mogi_das_Cruzes" title="Mogi das Cruzes">Mogi das Cruzes</a>, <a href="/wiki/S%C3%A3o_Paulo_(state)" title="São Paulo (state)">São Paulo</a>, to Neymar Santos Sr. and Nadine da Silva. He inherited his name from his father, who is a former footballer and became his son's advisor as Neymar's talents began to grow.<sup id="cite_ref-16" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-16">&#91;15&#93;</a></sup> Neymar comments on his father's role: "My father has been by my side since I was little. He takes care of things, my finances and my family."<sup id="cite_ref-Samba_Star_17-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Samba_Star-17">&#91;16&#93;</a></sup> Growing up, Neymar combined his love of <a href="/wiki/Futsal" title="Futsal">futsal</a> with <a href="/wiki/Street_football" title="Street football">street football</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Back_Page_18-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Back_Page-18">&#91;17&#93;</a></sup> Neymar said that futsal had a massive influence on him growing up, helping him develop his technique, speed of thought and ability to perform moves in tight spaces.<sup id="cite_ref-19" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-19">&#91;18&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>In 2003, Neymar moved with his family to <a href="/wiki/S%C3%A3o_Vicente,_S%C3%A3o_Paulo" title="São Vicente, São Paulo">São Vicente</a>, where he began playing for youth side <a href="/wiki/Associa%C3%A7%C3%A3o_Atl%C3%A9tica_Portuguesa_(Santos)" title="Associação Atlética Portuguesa (Santos)">Portuguesa Santista</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-20" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-20">&#91;19&#93;</a></sup> Then, later in 2003, they moved to <a href="/wiki/Santos,_S%C3%A3o_Paulo" title="Santos, São Paulo">Santos</a>, where Neymar joined <a href="/wiki/Santos_FC" title="Santos FC">Santos FC</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-21" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-21">&#91;20&#93;</a></sup> With the success of his youth career and added income, the family bought their first property, a house next to Vila Belmiro, Santos' home stadium. Their quality of family life improved, as at age 15, Neymar was earning 10,000 <a href="/wiki/Brazilian_real" title="Brazilian real">reais</a> per month and at 16, 125,000 reais per month. At 17, he signed his first full professional contract, was upgraded to the Santos first team, and began signing his first <a href="/wiki/Sponsor_(commercial)" title="Sponsor (commercial)">sponsorship</a> deals.<sup id="cite_ref-Merca_Foot_22-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Merca_Foot-22">&#91;21&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Club_career">Club career</span></h2>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Santos">Santos</span></h3>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Youth">Youth</span></h4>
<p>Neymar began playing football at an early age and he was soon spotted by <a href="/wiki/Santos_FC" title="Santos FC">Santos FC</a> who offered him a contract in 2003, where he was inducted into their <a href="/wiki/Football_academy" class="mw-redirect" title="Football academy">youth academy</a>, which has, in the past, produced Brazilian internationals like <a href="/wiki/Ant%C3%B4nio_Wilson_Vieira_Hon%C3%B3rio" title="Antônio Wilson Vieira Honório">Coutinho</a>, <a href="/wiki/Clodoaldo" title="Clodoaldo">Clodoaldo</a>, <a href="/wiki/Diego_(footballer,_born_1985)" title="Diego (footballer, born 1985)">Diego</a>, <a href="/wiki/Elano" title="Elano">Elano</a> and <a href="/wiki/Alex_(footballer,_born_1982)" title="Alex (footballer, born 1982)">Alex</a>. He also joined the likes of <a href="/wiki/Jos%C3%A9_Macia" class="mw-redirect" title="José Macia">Pepe</a>, <a href="/wiki/Pel%C3%A9" title="Pelé">Pelé</a> and <a href="/wiki/Robinho" title="Robinho">Robinho</a> in starting out his career at the club, nicknamed <i>Peixe</i>.<sup id="cite_ref-Santos_Player_Profile_23-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Santos_Player_Profile-23">&#91;22&#93;</a></sup> While in the youth academy, Neymar met <a href="/wiki/Paulo_Henrique_Ganso" title="Paulo Henrique Ganso">Paulo Henrique Ganso</a>, becoming good friends in the process. Aged 14, Neymar travelled to Spain for try outs with the <a href="/wiki/Real_Madrid_C.F." class="mw-redirect" title="Real Madrid C.F.">Real Madrid</a> youth team, at the time when Real had stars like <a href="/wiki/Ronaldo_(Brazilian_footballer)" title="Ronaldo (Brazilian footballer)">Ronaldo</a>, <a href="/wiki/Zinedine_Zidane" title="Zinedine Zidane">Zinedine Zidane</a>, <a href="/wiki/David_Beckham" title="David Beckham">David Beckham</a>, <a href="/wiki/Roberto_Carlos" title="Roberto Carlos">Roberto Carlos</a> and Robinho.  He did not stay in Madrid, however, as his father decided at the time that he preferred the young prodigy to keep growing up while playing at Santos.<sup id="cite_ref-24" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-24">&#91;23&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-25" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-25">&#91;24&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="2009:_Debut_season">2009: Debut season</span></h4>
<p>Neymar made his professional debut on 7 March 2009, despite being only 17 years old; he was brought on for the last thirty minutes, in a 2–1 win against <a href="/wiki/Oeste_Futebol_Clube" title="Oeste Futebol Clube">Oeste</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Back_Page_18-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Back_Page-18">&#91;17&#93;</a></sup> The following week he scored his first goal for Santos against <a href="/wiki/Mogi_Mirim_Esporte_Clube" title="Mogi Mirim Esporte Clube">Mogi Mirim</a>. One month later, on 11 April, Neymar scored the decisive goal in a 2–1 win against <a href="/wiki/Sociedade_Esportiva_Palmeiras" title="Sociedade Esportiva Palmeiras">Palmeiras</a> in the <a href="/wiki/Campeonato_Paulista_2009#Semi-finals" class="mw-redirect" title="Campeonato Paulista 2009">2009 Campeonato Paulista semi-final first leg</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-26" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-26">&#91;25&#93;</a></sup> In the final, however, Santos suffered a 4–2 aggregate defeat to <a href="/wiki/Sport_Club_Corinthians_Paulista" title="Sport Club Corinthians Paulista">Corinthians</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-27" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-27">&#91;26&#93;</a></sup> In his first season, Neymar racked up 14 goals in 48 games.<sup id="cite_ref-Back_Page_18-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Back_Page-18">&#91;17&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="2010:_Campeonato_Paulista_success">2010: Campeonato Paulista success</span></h4>
<div class="quotebox pullquote floatright" style="width:26%; ;"><style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r1012376600">.mw-parser-output .quotebox{background-color:#F9F9F9;border:1px solid #aaa;box-sizing:border-box;padding:10px;font-size:88%;max-width:100%}.mw-parser-output .quotebox.floatleft{margin:0.5em 1.4em 0.8em 0}.mw-parser-output .quotebox.floatright{margin:0.5em 0 0.8em 1.4em}.mw-parser-output .quotebox.centered{margin:0.5em auto 0.8em auto}.mw-parser-output .quotebox.floatleft p,.mw-parser-output .quotebox.floatright p{font-style:inherit}.mw-parser-output .quotebox-title{background-color:#F9F9F9;text-align:center;font-size:larger;font-weight:bold}.mw-parser-output .quotebox-quote.quoted:before{font-family:"Times New Roman",serif;font-weight:bold;font-size:large;color:gray;content:" “ ";vertical-align:-45%;line-height:0}.mw-parser-output .quotebox-quote.quoted:after{font-family:"Times New Roman",serif;font-weight:bold;font-size:large;color:gray;content:" ” ";line-height:0}.mw-parser-output .quotebox .left-aligned{text-align:left}.mw-parser-output .quotebox .right-aligned{text-align:right}.mw-parser-output .quotebox .center-aligned{text-align:center}.mw-parser-output .quotebox cite{display:block;font-style:normal}@media screen and (max-width:640px){.mw-parser-output .quotebox{width:100%!important;margin:0 0 0.8em!important;float:none!important}}</style>
<div class="quotebox-quote left-aligned" style="">"The 18-year-old is a magnificent prospect. He is sleek and skilful, able to beat the defender on either side, capable of combining well, and full of tricks he can put to productive use in and around the penalty area."</div>
<p><cite class="left-aligned" style="">—South American football journalist <a href="/wiki/Tim_Vickery" title="Tim Vickery">Tim Vickery</a> on Neymar in 2010.<sup id="cite_ref-28" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-28">&#91;27&#93;</a></sup></cite>
</p>
</div>
<p>Neymar continued his ascendancy in 2010, and, on 15 April 2010, he scored five goals for Santos in an 8–1 rout of <a href="/wiki/Guarani_FC" title="Guarani FC">Guarani</a> in the qualifying stages of the Brazilian Cup.<sup id="cite_ref-29" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-29">&#91;28&#93;</a></sup> Following the 2010 Campeonato Paulista in which Neymar scored 14 goals in 19 games,<sup id="cite_ref-Santos_Player_Profile_23-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Santos_Player_Profile-23">&#91;22&#93;</a></sup> the club were crowned champions after a 5–5 aggregate win over <a href="/wiki/Esporte_Clube_Santo_Andr%C3%A9" title="Esporte Clube Santo André">Santo André</a> in the finals.<sup id="cite_ref-30" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-30">&#91;29&#93;</a></sup> Neymar was subsequently given the award for the best player in the competition.<sup id="cite_ref-31" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-31">&#91;30&#93;</a></sup>
Neymar's performances for Santos have drawn comparisons to other Brazilians, including Robinho and Brazilian legend Pelé.<sup id="cite_ref-Neymar_Scouting_32-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Neymar_Scouting-32">&#91;31&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>In 2010, Santos rejected a £12&#160;million bid for him from English <a href="/wiki/Premier_League" title="Premier League">Premier League</a> team <a href="/wiki/West_Ham_United_F.C." title="West Ham United F.C.">West Ham United</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-33" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-33">&#91;32&#93;</a></sup> and later an offer from another English club, <a href="/wiki/Chelsea_F.C." title="Chelsea F.C.">Chelsea</a>, reported to be in the region of £20&#160;million.<sup id="cite_ref-chelseachase_34-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-chelseachase-34">&#91;33&#93;</a></sup> Despite Santos unwillingness to sell and Neymar himself insisting "I'm focused only on Santos",<sup id="cite_ref-Brazilians_want_Neymar_35-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Brazilians_want_Neymar-35">&#91;34&#93;</a></sup> his agent, Wagner Ribeiro, indicated that Neymar's career was elsewhere, stating "He wants to become the best player in the world. The chances of him doing that while playing in Brazil are zero."<sup id="cite_ref-chelseachase_34-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-chelseachase-34">&#91;33&#93;</a></sup> Although one year later Neymar admitted, in an interview with the <i><a href="/wiki/Daily_Telegraph" class="mw-redirect" title="Daily Telegraph">Daily Telegraph</a></i>, that he had been happy with Chelsea's interest in him as it was a "dream" of his "to play in Europe", while also stating that at the time it had been the right decision to stay in Brazil.<sup id="cite_ref-36" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-36">&#91;35&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>On 30 November 2010, Santos sold a 5% share of future transfer fees that he would receive to an investment group, Terceira Estrela Investimentos S.A. (TEISA), for <a href="/wiki/Brazilian_real" title="Brazilian real">R$</a> 3,549,900 (€1.5&#160;million).<sup id="cite_ref-37" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-37">&#91;36&#93;</a></sup> The previous year, his family had sold a 40% stake in Neymar's sporting rights to the <a href="/wiki/DIS_Esporte" title="DIS Esporte">DIS Esporte group</a> who had been a long-term strategic partner of Santos' football club.<sup id="cite_ref-38" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-38">&#91;37&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Despite his first two seasons being highly successful, having ended the 2010 season with an impressive 42 goals in 60 games, problems had been identified, namely Neymar's apparent taste for diving when tackled, rather than attempting to continue his run, and his attitude. The latter came to the forefront during a match with <a href="/wiki/Atl%C3%A9tico_Clube_Goianiense" title="Atlético Clube Goianiense">Atlético Goianiense</a>, on 15 September 2010, when the Santos' manager, <a href="/wiki/Dorival_J%C3%BAnior" title="Dorival Júnior">Dorival Júnior</a>, appointed another player to take the penalty awarded for a foul on Neymar. His decision was based on the fact that Neymar had missed a crucial penalty during the <a href="/wiki/Copa_do_Brasil_2010#Final_phase" class="mw-redirect" title="Copa do Brasil 2010">Copa do Brasil final</a> of that year, even if Santos went on to win. Reacting to this, Neymar turned his back on his manager, had to be calmed down by a linesman and argued with his captain, <a href="/wiki/Edu_Dracena" title="Edu Dracena">Edu Dracena</a>. The fallout from this event was that Dorival Júnior wished to have Neymar suspended for two weeks, but the board sided with the player and promptly sacked the manager. Despite Neymar's apologies over the incident, some doubts still remain about his attitude.<sup id="cite_ref-Back_Page_18-3" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Back_Page-18">&#91;17&#93;</a></sup> In December 2010, aged just 18, Neymar came third for the <a href="/wiki/2010_South_American_Footballer_of_the_Year" title="2010 South American Footballer of the Year">2010 South American Footballer of the Year</a>, behind <a href="/wiki/Andr%C3%A9s_D%27Alessandro" title="Andrés D&#39;Alessandro">Andrés D'Alessandro</a> and <a href="/wiki/Juan_Sebasti%C3%A1n_Ver%C3%B3n" title="Juan Sebastián Verón">Juan Sebastián Verón</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-39" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-39">&#91;38&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span id="2011:_Pusk.C3.A1s_Award"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="2011:_Puskás_Award">2011: Puskás Award</span></h4>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Neymar_Junior_the_Future_of_Brazil_2.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/23/Neymar_Junior_the_Future_of_Brazil_2.jpg/220px-Neymar_Junior_the_Future_of_Brazil_2.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="218" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/23/Neymar_Junior_the_Future_of_Brazil_2.jpg/330px-Neymar_Junior_the_Future_of_Brazil_2.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/23/Neymar_Junior_the_Future_of_Brazil_2.jpg/440px-Neymar_Junior_the_Future_of_Brazil_2.jpg 2x" data-file-width="3308" data-file-height="3279" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Neymar_Junior_the_Future_of_Brazil_2.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Neymar playing for Santos against <a href="/wiki/FC_Barcelona" title="FC Barcelona">Barcelona</a> in the <a href="/wiki/2011_FIFA_Club_World_Cup_Final" title="2011 FIFA Club World Cup Final">2011 FIFA Club World Cup Final</a> in Yokohama, Japan</div></div></div>
<p>Neymar scored six goals during Santos run to the <a href="/wiki/2011_Copa_Libertadores_Finals" title="2011 Copa Libertadores Finals">2011 Copa Libertadores Finals</a>, tying him for third top goalscorer,<sup id="cite_ref-40" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-40">&#91;39&#93;</a></sup> including the clinching goal of Santos' 4–3 aggregate win over <a href="/wiki/Cerro_Porte%C3%B1o" title="Cerro Porteño">Cerro Porteño</a> in the semi-finals.<sup id="cite_ref-41" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-41">&#91;40&#93;</a></sup> In the two-legged final, Santos faced Uruguayan side <a href="/wiki/C.A._Pe%C3%B1arol" class="mw-redirect" title="C.A. Peñarol">Peñarol</a> and drew the first leg 0–0 in <a href="/wiki/Montevideo" title="Montevideo">Montevideo</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-42" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-42">&#91;41&#93;</a></sup> At home in the second leg, Neymar opened the scoring in the 46th minute as Santos held on for a 2–1 win and Neymar won Man of the Match honours.<sup id="cite_ref-43" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-43">&#91;42&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-44" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-44">&#91;43&#93;</a></sup> The win brought Santos their first <a href="/wiki/Copa_Libertadores" title="Copa Libertadores">Copa Libertadores</a> triumph since 1963, when Brazilian legend Pelé was playing for the club.<sup id="cite_ref-45" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-45">&#91;44&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-46" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-46">&#91;45&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>In September 2011, Santos club president Luís Ribeiro threatened to report Real Madrid to <a href="/wiki/FIFA" title="FIFA">FIFA</a> following reports that they had attempted to sign Neymar to a pre-contract agreement, and denied that such an agreement was in place.<sup id="cite_ref-47" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-47">&#91;46&#93;</a></sup> On 9 November 2011, Neymar and Santos agreed to a contract extension that would see the player stay with the club until after the <a href="/wiki/2014_FIFA_World_Cup" title="2014 FIFA World Cup">2014 World Cup</a> in Brazil. The deal reportedly increased Neymar's wages by 50%, to the levels that top European clubs would be paying him.<sup id="cite_ref-48" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-48">&#91;47&#93;</a></sup> On 14 December 2011, Neymar scored the opening goal for Santos as they defeated <a href="/wiki/Kashiwa_Reysol" title="Kashiwa Reysol">Kashiwa Reysol</a> 3–1 in the semi-finals of the <a href="/wiki/2011_FIFA_Club_World_Cup" title="2011 FIFA Club World Cup">FIFA Club World Cup</a> at the <a href="/wiki/Toyota_Stadium_(Japan)" title="Toyota Stadium (Japan)">Toyota Stadium</a> in <a href="/wiki/Toyota,_Aichi" title="Toyota, Aichi">Toyota</a>, Japan, but failed to score against <a href="/wiki/FC_Barcelona" title="FC Barcelona">Barcelona</a> in the final on 18 December 2011, where Santos were defeated 4–0, finishing as runners-up in the competition.<sup id="cite_ref-49" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-49">&#91;48&#93;</a></sup> He won the 2011 <a href="/wiki/FIFA_Pusk%C3%A1s_Award" title="FIFA Puskás Award">FIFA Puskás Award</a> for scoring a solo goal in the <a href="/wiki/Campeonato_Brasileiro_S%C3%A9rie_A" title="Campeonato Brasileiro Série A">Brasileirão Série A</a> against <a href="/wiki/Clube_de_Regatas_do_Flamengo" title="Clube de Regatas do Flamengo">Flamengo</a>, in a 5–4 loss. On 31 December 2011, he won the <a href="/wiki/2011_South_American_Footballer_of_the_Year" title="2011 South American Footballer of the Year">2011 South American Footballer of the Year</a> award for the first time, by a record margin, following in the footsteps of <a href="/wiki/Diego_Maradona" title="Diego Maradona">Diego Maradona</a>, <a href="/wiki/Rom%C3%A1rio" title="Romário">Romário</a>, Pelé and <a href="/wiki/Zico_(footballer)" title="Zico (footballer)">Zico</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-50" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-50">&#91;49&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span id="2012:_South_America.27s_best_player"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="2012:_South_America's_best_player">2012: South America's best player</span></h4>
<p>On 5 February 2012, when he turned 20, Neymar scored his 100th goal as a professional football player, against Palmeiras in the <a href="/wiki/2012_Campeonato_Paulista" title="2012 Campeonato Paulista">Campeonato Paulista</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-51" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-51">&#91;50&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-52" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-52">&#91;51&#93;</a></sup> On 25 February 2012 – he scored two goals, one of which was from 25-yards – and created two assists to help his side to a 6–1 win over <a href="/wiki/Associa%C3%A7%C3%A3o_Atl%C3%A9tica_Ponte_Preta" title="Associação Atlética Ponte Preta">Ponte Preta</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-53" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-53">&#91;52&#93;</a></sup> On 7 March 2012, Neymar netted a <a href="/wiki/Hat-trick_(association_football)" class="mw-redirect" title="Hat-trick (association football)">hat-trick</a> as Santos saw off Brazilian rivals <a href="/wiki/Sport_Club_Internacional" title="Sport Club Internacional">Internacional</a> 3–1 in the <a href="/wiki/Copa_Libertadores" title="Copa Libertadores">Copa Libertadores</a> Group stage match.<sup id="cite_ref-54" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-54">&#91;53&#93;</a></sup> On 29 March, he scored a brace against <a href="/wiki/Guaratinguet%C3%A1_Futebol" title="Guaratinguetá Futebol">Guaratinguetá</a> in a 5–0 victory.<sup id="cite_ref-55" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-55">&#91;54&#93;</a></sup> In the fixture against <a href="/wiki/S%C3%A3o_Paulo_FC" title="São Paulo FC">São Paulo</a> on 29 April 2012, Neymar scored a hat-trick with the match ending 3–1.<sup id="cite_ref-56" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-56">&#91;55&#93;</a></sup> Thereafter, he went on to score twice in the <a href="/wiki/2012_Campeonato_Paulista_knockout_phase#First_leg" class="mw-redirect" title="2012 Campeonato Paulista knockout phase">first</a><sup id="cite_ref-57" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-57">&#91;56&#93;</a></sup> and <a href="/wiki/2012_Campeonato_Paulista_knockout_phase#Second_leg" class="mw-redirect" title="2012 Campeonato Paulista knockout phase">second legs</a><sup id="cite_ref-58" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-58">&#91;57&#93;</a></sup> in the <a href="/wiki/2012_Campeonato_Paulista_knockout_phase#Finals" class="mw-redirect" title="2012 Campeonato Paulista knockout phase">2012 Campeonato Paulista Finals</a> against <a href="/wiki/Guarani_FC" title="Guarani FC">Guarani</a>, which ended 7–2 on aggregate. Neymar finished the <a href="/wiki/2012_Campeonato_Paulista" title="2012 Campeonato Paulista">2012 Campeonato Paulista</a> with 20 goals and was voted the Best player and Best Forward, and Santos were crowned champions. He was joint top scorer in the <a href="/wiki/2012_Copa_Libertadores" title="2012 Copa Libertadores">Copa Libertadores</a> with eight goals, after Santos were beaten over two legs by eventual champions Corinthians in the semi-finals.
</p><p>On 25 August 2012, he scored a brace in the 2–1 away win at Palmeiras.<sup id="cite_ref-59" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-59">&#91;58&#93;</a></sup> On 3 November 2012, in the <a href="/wiki/Campeonato_Brasileiro_S%C3%A9rie_A" title="Campeonato Brasileiro Série A">Brasileiro Série A</a> away fixture at <a href="/wiki/Cruzeiro_Esporte_Clube" title="Cruzeiro Esporte Clube">Cruzeiro</a>, Neymar scored a hat-trick and assisted <a href="/wiki/Felipe_Anderson" title="Felipe Anderson">Felipe Anderson</a>'s goal, to help his side to a 4–0 win.<sup id="cite_ref-60" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-60">&#91;59&#93;</a></sup> Neymar finished off the 2012 season in style, first setting-up <a href="/wiki/Victor_Andrade" title="Victor Andrade">Victor Andrade</a>'s equaliser, then scoring twice, to give Santos a 3–1 home win over Palmeiras on 1 December 2012.<sup id="cite_ref-61" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-61">&#91;60&#93;</a></sup> Neymar was voted the Best Player of the <a href="/wiki/2012_Recopa_Sudamericana" title="2012 Recopa Sudamericana">2012 Recopa Sudamericana</a>, with himself scoring in the second leg to win the title 2–0 on aggregate. He finished the 2012 Campeonato Brasileiro Série A with 14 goals and being voted the Best forward. Neymar finished the 2012 season, being award the <a href="/wiki/Bola_de_Ouro" title="Bola de Ouro">Golden Ball</a>, Arthur Friedenreich Award and Armando Nogueira Trophy. He was one of three finalists in the 2012 <a href="/wiki/FIFA_Pusk%C3%A1s_Award" title="FIFA Puskás Award">FIFA Puskás Award</a> and finished runners-up behind <a href="/wiki/Miroslav_Stoch" title="Miroslav Stoch">Miroslav Stoch</a>. He won the <a href="/wiki/2012_South_American_Footballer_of_the_Year" title="2012 South American Footballer of the Year">2012 South American Footballer of the Year</a>, retaining his award and winning it ahead of the likes of <a href="/wiki/Ronaldinho" title="Ronaldinho">Ronaldinho</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-62" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-62">&#91;61&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="2013:_Final_season">2013: Final season</span></h4>
<p>Neymar started the <a href="/wiki/2013_Campeonato_Paulista" title="2013 Campeonato Paulista">2013 Campeonato Paulista</a> scoring twice in the first match, which ended a 3–1 win over <a href="/wiki/S%C3%A3o_Bernardo_Futebol_Clube" title="São Bernardo Futebol Clube">São Bernardo</a> on 19 January 2013.<sup id="cite_ref-63" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-63">&#91;62&#93;</a></sup> Four days later on 23 January 2013, Neymar scored again against <a href="/wiki/Botafogo_Futebol_Clube_(SP)" title="Botafogo Futebol Clube (SP)">Botafogo</a> in a 3–0 win.<sup id="cite_ref-64" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-64">&#91;63&#93;</a></sup> On 3 February 2013, in the Paulista fixture against São Paulo, where Santos won 3–1, with Neymar scoring and making two assists.<sup id="cite_ref-65" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-65">&#91;64&#93;</a></sup> on 18 March 2013, Neymar told that he had a "dream of playing in Europe, for a big club like Barcelona, Real Madrid and Chelsea." But he went on to say, "There's no point in speculating when I'll leave Santos. I'll leave when I want to."<sup id="cite_ref-66" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-66">&#91;65&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Neymar scored all four goals, had another disallowed and hit the post as Santos beat <a href="/wiki/Uni%C3%A3o_Agr%C3%ADcola_Barbarense_Futebol_Clube" title="União Agrícola Barbarense Futebol Clube">União Barbarense</a> 4–0 in the Paulista on 13 April.<sup id="cite_ref-67" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-67">&#91;66&#93;</a></sup> On 25 April 2013, his agent and father revealed that Neymar intended to leave for Europe before the <a href="/wiki/2014_FIFA_World_Cup" title="2014 FIFA World Cup">2014 FIFA World Cup</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-68" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-68">&#91;67&#93;</a></sup> Ahead of his last match for Santos, on 26 May against Flamengo, Neymar was in tears during the national anthem.<sup id="cite_ref-69" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-69">&#91;68&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Barcelona">Barcelona</span></h3>
<div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable">See also: <a href="/wiki/Transfer_(association_football)#2013:_Transfer_of_Neymar_from_Santos_to_Barcelona" title="Transfer (association football)">Transfer (association football) §&#160;2013: Transfer of Neymar from Santos to Barcelona</a></div>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:192px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Neymar_Barcelona_presentation_1.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/22/Neymar_Barcelona_presentation_1.jpg/190px-Neymar_Barcelona_presentation_1.jpg" decoding="async" width="190" height="274" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/22/Neymar_Barcelona_presentation_1.jpg/285px-Neymar_Barcelona_presentation_1.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/22/Neymar_Barcelona_presentation_1.jpg/380px-Neymar_Barcelona_presentation_1.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1662" data-file-height="2401" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Neymar_Barcelona_presentation_1.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Neymar during his unveiling at Barcelona in June 2013</div></div></div>
<p>On 24 May 2013, Santos announced that they had received two offers for Neymar. The following day, Neymar announced he would sign with Barcelona on 27 May 2013 and join the team after playing in the <a href="/wiki/2013_FIFA_Confederations_Cup" title="2013 FIFA Confederations Cup">2013 FIFA Confederations Cup</a>. Neither Neymar nor the clubs released details on the transfer fee or personal terms, save to say he signed a five-year deal.<sup id="cite_ref-70" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-70">&#91;69&#93;</a></sup> On 3 June 2013, Neymar was unveiled by Barcelona after passing medical tests and signing a contract that would keep him at the club through June 2018.<sup id="cite_ref-71" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-71">&#91;70&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Neymar was presented at the <a href="/wiki/Camp_Nou" title="Camp Nou">Camp Nou</a> in front of 56,500 fans, a record turnout for a Brazilian player.<sup id="cite_ref-72" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-72">&#91;71&#93;</a></sup> Club vice-president <a href="/wiki/Josep_Maria_Bartomeu" title="Josep Maria Bartomeu">Josep Maria Bartomeu</a> initially said Neymar's transfer fee was €57.1&#160;million and his release clause set at €190&#160;million.<sup id="cite_ref-73" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-73">&#91;72&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-74" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-74">&#91;73&#93;</a></sup> Barcelona's doctor suggested he might need to gain weight to be able to cope physically in Spanish football.<sup id="cite_ref-75" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-75">&#91;74&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Transfer_investigation">Transfer investigation</span></h4>
<p>In January 2014, the prosecutor's office in <a href="/wiki/Madrid" title="Madrid">Madrid</a> began investigating the transfer fee that Barcelona paid for Neymar.<sup id="cite_ref-Staatsanwaltschaft_untersucht_Transfer_von_Neymar_76-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Staatsanwaltschaft_untersucht_Transfer_von_Neymar-76">&#91;75&#93;</a></sup> The documents submitted to the authorities on request contained contradictory information.<sup id="cite_ref-Staatsanwaltschaft_untersucht_Transfer_von_Neymar_76-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Staatsanwaltschaft_untersucht_Transfer_von_Neymar-76">&#91;75&#93;</a></sup> On 23 January 2014, <a href="/wiki/Sandro_Rosell" title="Sandro Rosell">Rosell</a> resigned from his position as president.<sup id="cite_ref-77" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-77">&#91;76&#93;</a></sup> A day later, the details of the transfer were revealed by Barcelona; the transfer had in fact cost them €86.2&#160;million (<a href="/wiki/Pound_sterling" title="Pound sterling">£</a>71.5&#160;million),<sup id="cite_ref-BBC_Real_78-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-BBC_Real-78">&#91;77&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-SkyReal_79-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-SkyReal-79">&#91;78&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-80" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-80">&#91;79&#93;</a></sup> with Neymar's parents confirmed to have received a €40&#160;million sum.<sup id="cite_ref-81" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-81">&#91;80&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-82" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-82">&#91;81&#93;</a></sup> In the aftermath, Barcelona and Bartomeu were charged with <a href="/wiki/Tax_fraud" class="mw-redirect" title="Tax fraud">tax fraud</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-83" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-83">&#91;82&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span id="2013.E2.80.9314:_Adapting_to_Spain"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="2013–14:_Adapting_to_Spain">2013–14: Adapting to Spain</span></h4>
<p>On 30 July 2013, Barcelona drew 2–2 against <a href="/wiki/Lechia_Gda%C5%84sk" title="Lechia Gdask">Lechia Gdask</a> in a pre-season friendly; Neymar made his unofficial debut when he came on as a substitute.<sup id="cite_ref-84" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-84">&#91;83&#93;</a></sup> He scored his first goal for the club in a 7–1 win against a Thailand XI on 7 August. at the <a href="/wiki/Rajamangala_National_Stadium" class="mw-redirect" title="Rajamangala National Stadium">Rajamangala National Stadium</a><sup id="cite_ref-85" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-85">&#91;84&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Neymar made his competitive debut for Barcelona during the opening game of the <a href="/wiki/2013%E2%80%9314_FC_Barcelona_season" title="2013–14 FC Barcelona season">2013–14</a> <a href="/wiki/2013%E2%80%9314_La_Liga" title="2013–14 La Liga">La Liga</a> season as a 63rd-minute substitute for <a href="/wiki/Alexis_S%C3%A1nchez" title="Alexis Sánchez">Alexis Sánchez</a> in a 7–0 win against <a href="/wiki/Levante_UD" title="Levante UD">Levante</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-86" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-86">&#91;85&#93;</a></sup> On 21 August, he scored his first competitive goal for the club in the first leg of the <a href="/wiki/2013_Supercopa_de_Espa%C3%B1a" title="2013 Supercopa de España">2013</a> <a href="/wiki/Supercopa_de_Espa%C3%B1a" title="Supercopa de España">Supercopa de España</a> against <a href="/wiki/Atl%C3%A9tico_Madrid" title="Atlético Madrid">Atlético Madrid</a>: seven minutes after coming on as a substitute for <a href="/wiki/Pedro_(footballer,_born_July_1987)" class="mw-redirect" title="Pedro (footballer, born July 1987)">Pedro</a>, he headed <a href="/wiki/Dani_Alves" title="Dani Alves">Dani Alves</a>' cross to equalise in a 1–1 draw at the <a href="/wiki/Vicente_Calder%C3%B3n_Stadium" title="Vicente Calderón Stadium">Vicente Calderón Stadium</a> as Barcelona won on the <a href="/wiki/Away_goals_rule" title="Away goals rule">away goals rule</a> for his first trophy at the club.<sup id="cite_ref-87" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-87">&#91;86&#93;</a></sup> On 18 September, he made his <a href="/wiki/UEFA_Champions_League" title="UEFA Champions League">UEFA Champions League</a> debut, <a href="/wiki/Assist_(football)" class="mw-redirect" title="Assist (football)">assisting</a> a <a href="/wiki/Gerard_Piqu%C3%A9" title="Gerard Piqué">Gerard Piqué</a> goal as Barça beat <a href="/wiki/AFC_Ajax" title="AFC Ajax">Ajax</a> 4–0 in their opening match of the <a href="/wiki/2013%E2%80%9314_UEFA_Champions_League" title="2013–14 UEFA Champions League">2013–14 tournament</a>.
</p><p>Six days later, Neymar scored his first goal in La Liga in Barcelona's 4–1 defeat of <a href="/wiki/Real_Sociedad" title="Real Sociedad">Real Sociedad</a> at Camp Nou.<sup id="cite_ref-88" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-88">&#91;87&#93;</a></sup> On 26 October, he made his first <i><a href="/wiki/El_Cl%C3%A1sico" title="El Clásico">El Clásico</a></i> appearance, scoring the opening goal and assisting the team's winning goal scored by Alexis Sánchez as Barcelona beat Real Madrid 2–1 at Camp Nou.<sup id="cite_ref-clasico_89-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-clasico-89">&#91;88&#93;</a></sup> On 11 December, Neymar recorded his first <a href="/wiki/List_of_UEFA_Champions_League_hat-tricks" title="List of UEFA Champions League hat-tricks">three Champions League goals</a> as he scored a <a href="/wiki/Hat-trick_(association_football)" class="mw-redirect" title="Hat-trick (association football)">hat-trick</a> in a 6–1 win over <a href="/wiki/Celtic_F.C." title="Celtic F.C.">Celtic</a> in Barcelona's final <a href="/wiki/2013%E2%80%9314_UEFA_Champions_League_group_stage#Group_H" title="2013–14 UEFA Champions League group stage">Group H</a> match.<sup id="cite_ref-90" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-90">&#91;89&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span id="2014.E2.80.9315:_The_treble_and_individual_success"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="2014–15:_The_treble_and_individual_success">2014–15: The treble and individual success</span></h4>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:172px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Neymar_(cropped).jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/22/Neymar_%28cropped%29.jpg/170px-Neymar_%28cropped%29.jpg" decoding="async" width="170" height="282" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/22/Neymar_%28cropped%29.jpg/255px-Neymar_%28cropped%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/22/Neymar_%28cropped%29.jpg/340px-Neymar_%28cropped%29.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2028" data-file-height="3363" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Neymar_(cropped).jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Neymar playing for Barcelona against <a href="/wiki/Villarreal_CF" title="Villarreal CF">Villarreal</a> in La Liga, 1 February 2015. Neymar opened the scoring in Barcelona's 3–2 win.</div></div></div>
<p>On 13 September 2014, after appearing as a substitute, Neymar scored his first two goals of the <a href="/wiki/2014%E2%80%9315_FC_Barcelona_season" title="2014–15 FC Barcelona season">2014–15 season</a>, helping Barcelona beat <a href="/wiki/Athletic_Bilbao" title="Athletic Bilbao">Athletic Bilbao</a> 2–0. On 27 September, he scored a hat-trick against <a href="/wiki/Granada_CF" title="Granada CF">Granada</a> in a 6–0 win<sup id="cite_ref-91" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-91">&#91;90&#93;</a></sup> and scored in his next three <a href="/wiki/2014%E2%80%9315_La_Liga" title="2014–15 La Liga">La Liga</a> matches, including the opening goal in a 1–3 loss to Real Madrid at <a href="/wiki/Estadio_Santiago_Bernab%C3%A9u" class="mw-redirect" title="Estadio Santiago Bernabéu">Estadio Santiago Bernabéu</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-92" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-92">&#91;91&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>On 24 January 2015, Neymar scored twice and assisted two more goals in a 6–0 win at <a href="/wiki/Elche_CF" title="Elche CF">Elche</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-93" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-93">&#91;92&#93;</a></sup> On 28 January, he scored his 20th goal of the season in a 3–2 <a href="/wiki/2014%E2%80%9315_Copa_del_Rey" title="2014–15 Copa del Rey">Copa del Rey</a> quarter-final win over Atlético Madrid.<sup id="cite_ref-94" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-94">&#91;93&#93;</a></sup> On 4 March, Neymar scored twice in Barcelona's 3–1 Copa del Rey semi-final win over <a href="/wiki/Villarreal_CF" title="Villarreal CF">Villarreal</a> to qualify the club for its 37th Spanish Cup <a href="/wiki/2015_Copa_del_Rey_Final" title="2015 Copa del Rey Final">final</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-95" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-95">&#91;94&#93;</a></sup> On 21 April, Neymar took his tally to 30 goals for the season by scoring twice in Barcelona's 2–0 <a href="/wiki/2014%E2%80%9315_UEFA_Champions_League" title="2014–15 UEFA Champions League">Champions League</a> quarter-final win over <a href="/wiki/Paris_Saint-Germain_F.C." title="Paris Saint-Germain F.C.">Paris Saint-Germain</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-96" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-96">&#91;95&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>In May, the closing month of the season, Neymar scored the last goal in a 3–0 win against <a href="/wiki/FC_Bayern_Munich" title="FC Bayern Munich">Bayern Munich</a> in the first leg of the Champions League semi-final.<sup id="cite_ref-97" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-97">&#91;96&#93;</a></sup> A week later, he scored both the team's goals in a 3–2-second leg defeat at the <a href="/wiki/Allianz_Arena" title="Allianz Arena">Allianz Arena</a> to ensure <i>Barça</i> would qualify for the <a href="/wiki/2015_UEFA_Champions_League_Final" title="2015 UEFA Champions League Final">2015 UEFA Champions League Final</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-98" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-98">&#91;97&#93;</a></sup> He also opened the scoring with a header in a 2–0 league win versus Real Sociedad, a result which gave <i>Barça</i> a four-point lead over Real Madrid with only two matches remaining.<sup id="cite_ref-99" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-99">&#91;98&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Barcelona_fans_-_Champions_league_2015_Berlin.JPG" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e7/Barcelona_fans_-_Champions_league_2015_Berlin.JPG/220px-Barcelona_fans_-_Champions_league_2015_Berlin.JPG" decoding="async" width="220" height="165" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e7/Barcelona_fans_-_Champions_league_2015_Berlin.JPG/330px-Barcelona_fans_-_Champions_league_2015_Berlin.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e7/Barcelona_fans_-_Champions_league_2015_Berlin.JPG/440px-Barcelona_fans_-_Champions_league_2015_Berlin.JPG 2x" data-file-width="2592" data-file-height="1944" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Barcelona_fans_-_Champions_league_2015_Berlin.JPG" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Barcelona fans prior to the <a href="/wiki/2015_UEFA_Champions_League_Final" title="2015 UEFA Champions League Final">2015 UEFA Champions League Final</a> in Berlin holding up pictures of the attacking trio, Messi, Suárez and Neymar (MSN)</div></div></div>
<p>After securing the <a href="/wiki/List_of_Spanish_football_champions" title="List of Spanish football champions">league title</a> on 17 May with a 1–0 win over Atlético Madrid at the Vicente Calderón, Barcelona defeated Athletic Bilbao 3–1 at Camp Nou in the <a href="/wiki/2015_Copa_del_Rey_Final" title="2015 Copa del Rey Final">2015 Copa del Rey Final</a> on 30 May, with Neymar scoring the second goal for <i>Barça</i>.<sup id="cite_ref-100" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-100">&#91;99&#93;</a></sup> With Barcelona's victory likely, he performed tricks with the ball in the final stages of the game, which was deemed unsporting by opponent <a href="/wiki/Andoni_Iraola" title="Andoni Iraola">Andoni Iraola</a>. Barcelona manager <a href="/wiki/Luis_Enrique_(footballer)" class="mw-redirect" title="Luis Enrique (footballer)">Luis Enrique</a> claimed that it had to be understood that such behaviour was acceptable in Brazil, while Neymar himself did not apologise.<sup id="cite_ref-101" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-101">&#91;100&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>On 6 June 2015, Neymar scored the third goal for <i>Barça</i> in the 3–1 Champions League Final defeat of Italian champions <a href="/wiki/Juventus_F.C." title="Juventus F.C.">Juventus</a> at Berlin's <a href="/wiki/Olympiastadion_(Berlin)" title="Olympiastadion (Berlin)">Olympiastadion</a>, ensuring the club won its fifth <a href="/wiki/European_Champion_Clubs%27_Cup" title="European Champion Clubs&#39; Cup">European Cup</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-102" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-102">&#91;101&#93;</a></sup> This made Barcelona the first club in history to win <a href="/wiki/Treble_(association_football)" title="Treble (association football)">the treble</a> of domestic league, domestic cup and European Cup twice.<sup id="cite_ref-triple_103-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-triple-103">&#91;102&#93;</a></sup> On a personal note, he became the eighth player in football's history to win both the <a href="/wiki/Copa_Libertadores" title="Copa Libertadores">Copa Libertadores</a> and the UEFA Champions League, and the first player to score in final victories in both competitions.<sup id="cite_ref-104" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-104">&#91;103&#93;</a></sup> Neymar ended the season with 39 goals in all competitions and 10 in the Champions League, making him joint highest scorer with <a href="/wiki/Cristiano_Ronaldo" title="Cristiano Ronaldo">Cristiano Ronaldo</a> and teammate <a href="/wiki/Lionel_Messi" title="Lionel Messi">Lionel Messi</a> in the latter competition.<sup id="cite_ref-105" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-105">&#91;104&#93;</a></sup> He was the first player apart from those two to top the competition's scoring list, since compatriot <a href="/wiki/Kak%C3%A1" title="Kaká">Kaká</a> in <a href="/wiki/2006%E2%80%9307_UEFA_Champions_League" title="2006–07 UEFA Champions League">2006–07</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-106" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-106">&#91;105&#93;</a></sup> Barcelona's attacking trio of Messi, <a href="/wiki/Luis_Su%C3%A1rez" title="Luis Suárez">Luis Suárez</a> and Neymar, dubbed "MSN", ended with 122 goals, the most in a season for an attacking trio in Spanish football history.<sup id="cite_ref-107" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-107">&#91;106&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span id="2015.E2.80.9316:_Domestic_double"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="2015–16:_Domestic_double">2015–16: Domestic double</span></h4>
<table role="presentation" class="mbox-small plainlinks sistersitebox" style="background-color:#f9f9f9;border:1px solid #aaa;color:#000">
<tbody><tr>
<td class="mbox-image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/24/Wikinews-logo.svg/40px-Wikinews-logo.svg.png" decoding="async" width="40" height="22" class="noviewer" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/24/Wikinews-logo.svg/60px-Wikinews-logo.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/24/Wikinews-logo.svg/80px-Wikinews-logo.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="759" data-file-height="415" /></td>
<td class="mbox-text plainlist">Wikinews has related news:
<div><ul><li><a href="https://en.wikinews.org/wiki/Footballers_Neymar,_Zlatan,_Nolito_sign_contracts" class="extiw" title="wikinews:Footballers Neymar, Zlatan, Nolito sign contracts"> Footballers Neymar, Zlatan, Nolito sign contracts</a></li></ul></div></td></tr>
</tbody></table>
<p>Due to having the <a href="/wiki/Mumps" title="Mumps">mumps</a>, Neymar was expected to miss the <a href="/wiki/2015_UEFA_Super_Cup" title="2015 UEFA Super Cup">2015 UEFA Super Cup</a> and the <a href="/wiki/2015_Supercopa_de_Espa%C3%B1a" title="2015 Supercopa de España">2015 Supercopa de España</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-108" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-108">&#91;107&#93;</a></sup> On 17 October, Neymar scored four goals in Barcelona's 5–2 home win over <a href="/wiki/Rayo_Vallecano" title="Rayo Vallecano">Rayo Vallecano</a> in La Liga, taking his total to eight goals for the season.<sup id="cite_ref-109" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-109">&#91;108&#93;</a></sup> On 21 November, Neymar scored one and provided a back heel assist for <a href="/wiki/Andr%C3%A9s_Iniesta" title="Andrés Iniesta">Andrés Iniesta</a> in Barcelona's 4–0 away win against Real Madrid.<sup id="cite_ref-110" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-110">&#91;109&#93;</a></sup> He scored twice in a 4–0 home win over Real Sociedad on 28 November, taking his La Liga total to 14 goals in 12 games.<sup id="cite_ref-111" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-111">&#91;110&#93;</a></sup> On 30 November, Neymar was shortlisted for the <a href="/wiki/2015_FIFA_Ballon_d%27Or" title="2015 FIFA Ballon d&#39;Or">2015 FIFA Ballon d'Or</a> alongside Messi and Ronaldo, and subsequently came third.<sup id="cite_ref-FIFA_2015_112-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FIFA_2015-112">&#91;111&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-113" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-113">&#91;112&#93;</a></sup> On 22 May 2016, Neymar scored a late goal in Barcelona's 2–0 <a href="/wiki/Overtime_(sports)" title="Overtime (sports)">extra time</a> win over <a href="/wiki/Sevilla_FC" title="Sevilla FC">Sevilla</a> in the <a href="/wiki/2016_Copa_del_Rey_Final" title="2016 Copa del Rey Final">2016 Copa del Rey Final</a> at the Vicente Calderón, as the club celebrated winning the <a href="/wiki/Double_(association_football)#Spain" title="Double (association football)">domestic double</a> for the second consecutive season, following their treble victory from the previous season.<sup id="cite_ref-114" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-114">&#91;113&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-115" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-115">&#91;114&#93;</a></sup> The front three of Messi, Suárez and Neymar finished the season with 131 goals, breaking the record they had set the previous year for most goals by an attacking trio in a single season.<sup id="cite_ref-116" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-116">&#91;115&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span id="2016.E2.80.9317:_Final_season"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="2016–17:_Final_season">2016–17: Final season</span></h4>
<div class="quotebox pullquote floatright" style=";"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1012376600"/>
<div class="quotebox-quote left-aligned" style="">"While there is a 1% chance, we will have<br />99% faith."</div>
<p><cite class="left-aligned" style="">— Neymar after the 4–0 loss against <a href="/wiki/Paris_Saint-Germain" class="mw-redirect" title="Paris Saint-Germain">PSG</a><br />on 15 February 2017<sup id="cite_ref-117" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-117">&#91;116&#93;</a></sup></cite>
</p>
</div>
<p>In Barcelona's <a href="/wiki/Barcelona_6%E2%80%931_Paris_Saint-Germain" class="mw-redirect" title="Barcelona 6–1 Paris Saint-Germain">6–1 victory</a> over <a href="/wiki/Paris_Saint-Germain" class="mw-redirect" title="Paris Saint-Germain">Paris Saint-Germain</a> in the <a href="/wiki/2016%E2%80%9317_UEFA_Champions_League_knockout_phase#Barcelona_v_Paris_Saint-Germain" title="2016–17 UEFA Champions League knockout phase">2016–17 UEFA Champions League round of 16</a>, Neymar scored two goals and assisted the decisive goal of <a href="/wiki/Sergi_Roberto" title="Sergi Roberto">Sergi Roberto</a> during the closing seven-minute sequence.<sup id="cite_ref-118" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-118">&#91;117&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-119" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-119">&#91;118&#93;</a></sup> Overcoming the 4–0 loss to PSG in the first leg from 14 February 2017, this second leg match became the biggest comeback in Champions League history.<sup id="cite_ref-120" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-120">&#91;119&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>On 2 April 2017, Neymar scored his 100th goal for Barcelona in his 177th appearance for the club, netting in a 4–1 win over <a href="/wiki/Granada_CF" title="Granada CF">Granada</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-121" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-121">&#91;120&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-122" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-122">&#91;121&#93;</a></sup> On 27 May, Neymar scored in the <a href="/wiki/2017_Copa_del_Rey_Final" title="2017 Copa del Rey Final">2017 Copa del Rey Final</a>, his 105th goal for the club, as Barcelona defeated <a href="/wiki/Deportivo_Alav%C3%A9s" title="Deportivo Alavés">Alavés</a> 3–1 at the <a href="/wiki/Vicente_Calder%C3%B3n_Stadium" title="Vicente Calderón Stadium">Vicente Calderón</a> in Madrid.<sup id="cite_ref-123" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-123">&#91;122&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Paris_Saint-Germain">Paris Saint-Germain</span></h3>
<style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r978413945/mw-parser-output/.tmulti">.mw-parser-output .tmulti .thumbinner{display:flex;flex-direction:column}.mw-parser-output .tmulti class="thumbcaption">Neymar performing a <a href="/wiki/Keepie-uppie" class="mw-redirect" title="Keepie-uppie">keepie-uppie</a> during his Paris Saint-Germain unveiling</div></div><div class="tsingle" style="width:162px;max-width:162px"><div class="thumbimage"><a href="/wiki/File:Neymar_Jr_Presentation.jpg" class="image"><img alt="photograph of two men standing next to each other on a football pitch" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e8/Neymar_Jr_Presentation.jpg/160px-Neymar_Jr_Presentation.jpg" decoding="async" width="160" height="240" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e8/Neymar_Jr_Presentation.jpg/240px-Neymar_Jr_Presentation.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e8/Neymar_Jr_Presentation.jpg/320px-Neymar_Jr_Presentation.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2823" data-file-height="4234" /></a></div><div class="thumbcaption">Neymar with <a href="/wiki/Nasser_Al-Khelaifi" title="Nasser Al-Khelaifi">Nasser Al-Khelaifi</a>, the PSG chairman and chief executive officer</div></div></div></div></div>
<p>On 3 August 2017, Barcelona announced that Neymar's legal representatives made a payment of €222&#160;million<sup id="cite_ref-124" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-124">&#91;123&#93;</a></sup> to the club, equal to the <a href="/wiki/Release_clause" class="mw-redirect" title="Release clause">release clause</a> of his contract, which constituted the <a href="/wiki/List_of_most_expensive_association_football_transfers" title="List of most expensive association football transfers">most expensive transfer ever</a>. The club informed UEFA so that they can determine any disciplinary responsibilities that may arise from this case.<sup id="cite_ref-FCB_Neymar_9-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-FCB_Neymar-9">&#91;9&#93;</a></sup> According to the <a href="/wiki/BBC" title="BBC">BBC</a>, in Spain, the release clause must be activated by the footballer himself. The situation was unusual, in that the fee was paid to the club directly, after <a href="/wiki/La_Liga" title="La Liga">La Liga</a> had refused to receive the payment.<sup id="cite_ref-125" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-125">&#91;124&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-BBC_Neymar_10-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-BBC_Neymar-10">&#91;10&#93;</a></sup> Usually, the buyout clause is deposited with La Liga in order to release the player from his contract, and the league then passes the money to the selling club. However, La Liga rejected the payment—citing violation of Financial Fair Play (FFP) rules by PSG, who are backed by money from Gulf state <a href="/wiki/Qatar" title="Qatar">Qatar</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-126" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-126">&#91;125&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Neymar joined French club <a href="/wiki/Paris_Saint-Germain_F.C." title="Paris Saint-Germain F.C.">Paris Saint-Germain</a> on a contract that would run until 2022.<sup id="cite_ref-127" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-127">&#91;126&#93;</a></sup> He was offered the <a href="/wiki/Number_10_jersey" class="mw-redirect" title="Number 10 jersey">number 10 jersey</a> by <a href="/wiki/Javier_Pastore" title="Javier Pastore">Javier Pastore</a> as a "welcome gift".<sup id="cite_ref-128" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-128">&#91;127&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-129" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-129">&#91;128&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Contract_breach_lawsuit">Contract breach lawsuit</span></h4>
<p>On 27 August 2017, FC Barcelona filed a lawsuit against Neymar, demanding he return the contract renewal bonus he received as well as €8.5&#160;million in damages and an additional 10% for the arrears. They claimed they are owed money that Neymar received as part of a renewal bonus when he signed a new contract in 2016. The club also requested Paris Saint-Germain to take on the responsibility for the payment of the fees if the player cannot do so himself.<sup id="cite_ref-130" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-130">&#91;129&#93;</a></sup> Neymar's lawyers announced that they would contest the case.<sup id="cite_ref-131" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-131">&#91;130&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span id="2017.E2.80.9318:_Debut_season_and_domestic_treble"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="2017–18:_Debut_season_and_domestic_treble">2017–18: Debut season and domestic treble</span></h4>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:172px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Edgar_I%C3%A9_vs_Neymar.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/dd/Edgar_I%C3%A9_vs_Neymar.jpg/170px-Edgar_I%C3%A9_vs_Neymar.jpg" decoding="async" width="170" height="290" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/dd/Edgar_I%C3%A9_vs_Neymar.jpg/255px-Edgar_I%C3%A9_vs_Neymar.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/dd/Edgar_I%C3%A9_vs_Neymar.jpg/340px-Edgar_I%C3%A9_vs_Neymar.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1437" data-file-height="2454" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Edgar_I%C3%A9_vs_Neymar.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Neymar playing for PSG against <a href="/wiki/LOSC_Lille" class="mw-redirect" title="LOSC Lille">Lille</a> in February 2018</div></div></div>
<p>Neymar made his debut for <i>Les Rouge-et-Bleu</i> on 13 August 2017, scoring a goal and assisting another in a 3–0 away victory over <a href="/wiki/En_Avant_de_Guingamp" class="mw-redirect" title="En Avant de Guingamp">Guingamp</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-132" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-132">&#91;131&#93;</a></sup> He added two more goals to his tally in the next <a href="/wiki/Ligue_1" title="Ligue 1">Ligue 1</a> fixture against <a href="/wiki/Toulouse_FC" title="Toulouse FC">Toulouse</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-133" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-133">&#91;132&#93;</a></sup> Forming a prolific attacking trio alongside teenage French prodigy <a href="/wiki/Kylian_Mbapp%C3%A9" title="Kylian Mbappé">Kylian Mbappé</a> and Uruguayan striker <a href="/wiki/Edinson_Cavani" title="Edinson Cavani">Edinson Cavani</a>, Neymar scored one each in PSG's two opening games of the <a href="/wiki/2017%E2%80%9318_UEFA_Champions_League_group_stage" title="2017–18 UEFA Champions League group stage">2017–18 UEFA Champions League group stage</a>, with the team winning 5–0 at <a href="/wiki/Celtic_F.C." title="Celtic F.C.">Celtic</a> and 3–0 at home over <a href="/wiki/FC_Bayern_Munich" title="FC Bayern Munich">Bayern Munich</a> respectively.<sup id="cite_ref-134" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-134">&#91;133&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-135" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-135">&#91;134&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>During a 3–0 defeat of rivals <a href="/wiki/Olympique_de_Marseille" title="Olympique de Marseille">Olympique de Marseille</a> on 25 February 2018, Neymar fractured the <a href="/wiki/Fifth_metatarsal_bone" title="Fifth metatarsal bone">fifth metatarsal bone</a> in his right foot. He travelled to <a href="/wiki/Belo_Horizonte" title="Belo Horizonte">Belo Horizonte</a> and underwent a successful operation on his foot.<sup id="cite_ref-136" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-136">&#91;135&#93;</a></sup> He failed to make another appearance for PSG while recovering from the injury, and consequently ended <a href="/wiki/2017%E2%80%9318_Paris_Saint-Germain_F.C._season" title="2017–18 Paris Saint-Germain F.C. season">his first season</a> in Paris with 28 goals in 30 matches.<sup id="cite_ref-137" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-137">&#91;136&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span id="2018.E2.80.9319:_Injury_and_league_title"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="2018–19:_Injury_and_league_title">2018–19: Injury and league title</span></h4>
<p>On 12 August 2018, Neymar scored PSG's opening league goal of the <a href="/wiki/2018%E2%80%9319_Paris_Saint-Germain_F.C._season" title="2018–19 Paris Saint-Germain F.C. season">2018–19 season</a> in a 3–0 win over <a href="/wiki/Stade_Malherbe_Caen" title="Stade Malherbe Caen">Caen</a> at Parc des Princes.<sup id="cite_ref-138" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-138">&#91;137&#93;</a></sup> Neymar scored from a penalty in his next game as PSG won 3–1 against <a href="/wiki/En_Avant_de_Guingamp" class="mw-redirect" title="En Avant de Guingamp">Guingamp</a> in Ligue 1.<sup id="cite_ref-139" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-139">&#91;138&#93;</a></sup> In the following league game, the front three of Neymar, Mbappé and Cavani all scored in a 3–1 win over <a href="/wiki/Angers_SCO" title="Angers SCO">Angers</a> at home, with Neymar scoring from Mbappé's cut back and setting up Cavani to score the opener.<sup id="cite_ref-140" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-140">&#91;139&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>On 3 October 2018, Neymar scored a hattrick in a 6–1 win over <a href="/wiki/Red_Star_Belgrade" title="Red Star Belgrade">Red Star Belgrade</a> in a <a href="/wiki/2018%E2%80%9319_UEFA_Champions_League" title="2018–19 UEFA Champions League">Champions League</a> group stage fixture.<sup id="cite_ref-141" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-141">&#91;140&#93;</a></sup> He suffered a foot injury in late January 2019 that kept him out of his side's Champions League round of 16 tie against <a href="/wiki/Manchester_United_F.C." title="Manchester United F.C.">Manchester United F.C.</a><sup id="cite_ref-142" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-142">&#91;141&#93;</a></sup> After United eliminated PSG, Neymar went on Instagram insulting video review officials for awarding a stoppage-time penalty to United. UEFA banned Neymar for three matches for the insult.<sup id="cite_ref-APgoad_143-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-APgoad-143">&#91;142&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>On 27 April 2019, Neymar scored in the <a href="/wiki/2019_Coupe_de_France_Final" title="2019 Coupe de France Final">2019 Coupe de France Final</a> against Rennes, but Rennes made a comeback and won on penalties. After the match, Neymar was caught on video appearing to punch a spectator in the face.<sup id="cite_ref-goalpunch_144-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-goalpunch-144">&#91;143&#93;</a></sup> The spectator had been filming and insulting PSG players. PSG said they supported Neymar "100 percent" over the incident.<sup id="cite_ref-APgoad_143-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-APgoad-143">&#91;142&#93;</a></sup> Neymar admitted he was wrong, but argued that neither he nor anyone else could have stayed indifferent. PSG coach Thomas Tuchel responded: "It's not easy to climb the stairs after a defeat. If we lose, we must show respect. You can't come into conflict with a spectator."<sup id="cite_ref-goalpunch_144-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-goalpunch-144">&#91;143&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span id="2019.E2.80.9320:_Suspended_season.2C_European_final"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="2019–20:_Suspended_season,_European_final">2019–20: Suspended season, European final</span></h4>
<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Neymar_vs_Lille.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/68/Neymar_vs_Lille.jpg/220px-Neymar_vs_Lille.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="190" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/68/Neymar_vs_Lille.jpg/330px-Neymar_vs_Lille.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/68/Neymar_vs_Lille.jpg/440px-Neymar_vs_Lille.jpg 2x" data-file-width="3918" data-file-height="3379" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Neymar_vs_Lille.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Neymar taking a penalty against Lille during a Ligue 1 match in 2020</div></div></div>
<p>In July 2019, Neymar was absent from training with PSG, with the club talking disciplinary action.<sup id="cite_ref-145" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-145">&#91;144&#93;</a></sup> Prior to the transfer deadline in late August, Neymar agreed to stay at PSG after talks broke down over a return to Barcelona.<sup id="cite_ref-146" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-146">&#91;145&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Neymar made his first appearance for PSG in the <a href="/wiki/2019%E2%80%9320_Paris_Saint-Germain_F.C._season" title="2019–20 Paris Saint-Germain F.C. season">2019–20 season</a> on 14 September 2019, in a 1–0 victory over <a href="/wiki/RC_Strasbourg_Alsace" title="RC Strasbourg Alsace">Strasbourg</a> in <a href="/wiki/2019%E2%80%9320_Ligue_1" title="2019–20 Ligue 1">Ligue 1</a>. He scored the winning goal in injury time in the second half from a <a href="/wiki/Bicycle_kick" title="Bicycle kick">bicycle kick</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-147" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-147">&#91;146&#93;</a></sup> One week later, he again scored a late winner, as PSG defeated <a href="/wiki/Olympique_Lyonnais" title="Olympique Lyonnais">Lyon</a> 1–0 at the <a href="/wiki/Parc_Olympique_Lyonnais" title="Parc Olympique Lyonnais">Parc Olympique Lyonnais</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-148" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-148">&#91;147&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Neymar suffered a hamstring injury in October while on international duty with Brazil,<sup id="cite_ref-149" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-149">&#91;148&#93;</a></sup> and returned to play for PSG during their <a href="/wiki/2019%E2%80%9320_UEFA_Champions_League_group_stage" title="2019–20 UEFA Champions League group stage">Champions League</a> group match against Real Madrid on 26 November in a 2–2 draw. On 18 February 2020, in the <a href="/wiki/2019%E2%80%9320_UEFA_Champions_League_knockout_phase#Borussia_Dortmund_v_Paris_Saint-Germain" title="2019–20 UEFA Champions League knockout phase">Champions League Round of 16</a> against <a href="/wiki/Borussia_Dortmund" title="Borussia Dortmund">Borussia Dortmund</a>, he scored a crucial away goal in the first leg at <a href="/wiki/Westfalenstadion" title="Westfalenstadion">Signal Iduna Park</a>, as PSG lost 2–1. In the second leg, Neymar's side defeated Dortmund and made a comeback of their own in the Champions League, winning the match 2–0 (3–2 on aggregate). He scored a header from a corner taken by Ángel Di María and also made a play which lead to his teammate, <a href="/wiki/Juan_Bernat" title="Juan Bernat">Juan Bernat</a>, scoring the second goal.<sup id="cite_ref-150" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-150">&#91;149&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Neymar won his third league title after PSG were awarded <a href="/wiki/Ligue_1" title="Ligue 1">Ligue 1</a> as the season finished early due to the <a href="/wiki/COVID-19_pandemic" title="COVID-19 pandemic">COVID-19 pandemic</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-151" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-151">&#91;150&#93;</a></sup> On 24 July 2020, in Paris Saint-Germain's first professional game back after the pandemic, Neymar scored his side's lone goal in a 1–0 win over <a href="/wiki/AS_Saint-%C3%89tienne" title="AS Saint-Étienne">Saint-Étienne</a> in the <a href="/wiki/2020_Coupe_de_France_Final" title="2020 Coupe de France Final">Coupe de France Final</a>, winning his second Coupe de France title with the club.<sup id="cite_ref-CDF_2020_152-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-CDF_2020-152">&#91;151&#93;</a></sup> On 31 July, Paris Saint-Germain won the <a href="/wiki/2020_Coupe_de_la_Ligue_Final" title="2020 Coupe de la Ligue Final">2020 Coupe de la Ligue Final</a> 6–5 on <a href="/wiki/Penalty_shoot-out_(association_football)" title="Penalty shoot-out (association football)">penalties</a> over Lyon, following a 0–0 draw after <a href="/wiki/Overtime_(sports)#Association_football" title="Overtime (sports)">extra time</a>, which saw the side complete a domestic treble, with Neymar netting one of the penalties in the shoot-out.<sup id="cite_ref-153" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-153">&#91;152&#93;</a></sup> In the Champions League quarter-final against <a href="/wiki/Atalanta_B.C." title="Atalanta B.C.">Atalanta</a> on 12 August, he assisted the equalising goal in injury time in an eventual 2–1 win.<sup id="cite_ref-154" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-154">&#91;153&#93;</a></sup> In the semi-final against <a href="/wiki/RB_Leipzig" title="RB Leipzig">RB Leipzig</a>, he assisted one goal in a 3–0 victory, which saw PSG reach the <a href="/wiki/2020_UEFA_Champions_League_Final" title="2020 UEFA Champions League Final">Champions League final</a> for the first time in its history;<sup id="cite_ref-155" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-155">&#91;154&#93;</a></sup> PSG eventually lost out 1–0 to Bayern Munich on 23 August.<sup id="cite_ref-156" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-156">&#91;155&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span id="2020.E2.80.9321:_Controversy.2C_goals.2C_and_injuries"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="2020–21:_Controversy,_goals,_and_injuries">2020–21: Controversy, goals, and injuries</span></h4>
<p>Neymar missed out on the first match of the <a href="/wiki/2020%E2%80%9321_Paris_Saint-Germain_F.C._season" title="2020–21 Paris Saint-Germain F.C. season">2020–21 season</a> because he had tested positive for <a href="/wiki/Coronavirus_disease_2019" class="mw-redirect" title="Coronavirus disease 2019">COVID-19</a> a week earlier;<sup id="cite_ref-157" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-157">&#91;156&#93;</a></sup> PSG went on to lose the game against <a href="/wiki/RC_Lens" title="RC Lens">Lens</a> by a score of 1–0.<sup id="cite_ref-158" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-158">&#91;157&#93;</a></sup> However, he returned to training before the match against <a href="/wiki/Olympique_de_Marseille" title="Olympique de Marseille">Marseille</a> on 13 September 2020.<sup id="cite_ref-159" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-159">&#91;158&#93;</a></sup> PSG lost <i><a href="/wiki/Le_Classique" title="Le Classique">Le Classique</a></i> for the first time since 2011 as OM were victorious 1–0 in a match that had 14 <a href="/wiki/Fouls_and_misconduct_(association_football)" title="Fouls and misconduct (association football)">yellow cards</a> and 5 <a href="/wiki/Fouls_and_misconduct_(association_football)" title="Fouls and misconduct (association football)">red cards</a> handed out by the referee, including one of each to Neymar.<sup id="cite_ref-160" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-160">&#91;159&#93;</a></sup> He was involved in an altercation with <a href="/wiki/%C3%81lvaro_Gonz%C3%A1lez_(footballer,_born_1990)" title="Álvaro González (footballer, born 1990)">Álvaro González</a> at the 97th minute of the match, in the midst of a brawl that erupted between the PSG and OM players. Neymar reported being racially abused by Álvaro, after being sent off for hitting him in the back of the head.<sup id="cite_ref-161" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-161">&#91;160&#93;</a></sup>
