</p><p>In the aftermath, Neymar hit back on <a href="/wiki/Social_media" title="Social media">social media</a>, as the Spanish defender denied saying any racist comments during the match.<sup id="cite_ref-162" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-162">&#91;161&#93;</a></sup> On 16 September, Neymar was handed a two-match ban for his actions; the <a href="/wiki/Ligue_de_Football_Professionnel" title="Ligue de Football Professionnel">LFP</a> also began an investigation into the alleged racist comments made by Álvaro.<sup id="cite_ref-163" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-163">&#91;162&#93;</a></sup> Several days before the decision made by the French league, Spanish radio station <a href="/wiki/Cadena_SER" title="Cadena SER">Cadena SER</a> claimed to have footage of Neymar racially abusing OM player <a href="/wiki/Hiroki_Sakai" title="Hiroki Sakai">Hiroki Sakai</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-164" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-164">&#91;163&#93;</a></sup> On 30 September, the LFP decided that both Álvaro and Neymar would receive no suspensions, because proof of their wrongdoings were insufficient.<sup id="cite_ref-165" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-165">&#91;164&#93;</a></sup> Additionally, the day after the ruling, Sakai denied on social media that Neymar had made racist comments toward him.<sup id="cite_ref-166" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-166">&#91;165&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Neymar scored his first two goals of the season in a 6–1 win against <a href="/wiki/Angers_SCO" title="Angers SCO">Angers</a> on 2 October.<sup id="cite_ref-167" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-167">&#91;166&#93;</a></sup> He entered the list of the <a href="/wiki/List_of_Paris_Saint-Germain_F.C._records_and_statistics#Top_scorers" title="List of Paris Saint-Germain F.C. records and statistics">top ten goal scorers in PSG history</a> by doing so, scoring his 72nd for the club, which put him level with <a href="/wiki/Ra%C3%AD" title="Raí">Raí</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-168" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-168">&#91;167&#93;</a></sup> On 28 October, Neymar suffered an adductor injury in a match against <a href="/wiki/%C4%B0stanbul_Ba%C5%9Fak%C5%9Fehir_F.K." title="stanbul Baakehir F.K.">stanbul Baakehir</a>, leaving the pitch after 26 minutes of play.<sup id="cite_ref-169" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-169">&#91;168&#93;</a></sup> He made his return to action as a substitute in a 3–2 loss against <a href="/wiki/AS_Monaco_FC" title="AS Monaco FC">Monaco</a> on 20 November,<sup id="cite_ref-170" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-170">&#91;169&#93;</a></sup> and scored his first goal after recovering from his injury in a 1–0 win against <a href="/wiki/RB_Leipzig" title="RB Leipzig">RB Leipzig</a> in the UEFA Champions League on 24 November.<sup id="cite_ref-171" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-171">&#91;170&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>On 28 November, Neymar scored his 50th goal in Ligue 1, converting a penalty in PSG's 2–2 draw against <a href="/wiki/FC_Girondins_de_Bordeaux" title="FC Girondins de Bordeaux">Bordeaux</a>. This made him the fastest player in the club's history to reach 50 league goals, doing so in only 58 matches.<sup id="cite_ref-172" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-172">&#91;171&#93;</a></sup> Four days later, on 2 December, he scored two goals in a 3–1 Champions League victory against <a href="/wiki/Manchester_United_F.C." title="Manchester United F.C.">Manchester United</a> at <a href="/wiki/Old_Trafford" title="Old Trafford">Old Trafford</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-173" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-173">&#91;172&#93;</a></sup> In PSG's final group match, Neymar scored his third career Champions League hat-trick against <a href="/wiki/%C4%B0stanbul_Ba%C5%9Fak%C5%9Fehir_F.K." title="stanbul Baakehir F.K.">stanbul Baakehir</a>, as his side won 5–1 and qualified for the knockout stage as group winners.<sup id="cite_ref-174" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-174">&#91;173&#93;</a></sup> He became the first player in European Cup and Champions League history to score 20 goals for two different clubs, scoring 21 goals for Barcelona in 40 games, and 20 for PSG in 25 games.<sup id="cite_ref-175" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-175">&#91;174&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>In a 1–0 loss to <a href="/wiki/Olympique_Lyonnais" title="Olympique Lyonnais">Lyon</a> on 13 December, Neymar suffered an ankle injury after a tackle from <a href="/wiki/Thiago_Mendes" title="Thiago Mendes">Thiago Mendes</a>, and had to be stretchered off the field.<sup id="cite_ref-176" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-176">&#91;175&#93;</a></sup> He avoided a fracture, but was ruled out of action for three weeks with a sprain.<sup id="cite_ref-177" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-177">&#91;176&#93;</a></sup> His return proved to be exactly one month after his injury, on 13 January 2021, in a 2–1 win over rivals Marseille in the <a href="/wiki/Troph%C3%A9e_des_Champions" title="Trophée des Champions">Trophée des Champions</a>, with Neymar scoring the winning goal from a penalty.<sup id="cite_ref-178" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-178">&#91;177&#93;</a></sup> He sustained a left adductor injury in a 1–0 win over <a href="/wiki/S.M._Caen" class="mw-redirect" title="S.M. Caen">Caen</a> on February 10, ruling him out for four weeks.<sup id="cite_ref-179" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-179">&#91;178&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="International_career">International career</span></h2>
<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Neymar.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/62/Neymar.jpg/220px-Neymar.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="147" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/62/Neymar.jpg/330px-Neymar.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/62/Neymar.jpg/440px-Neymar.jpg 2x" data-file-width="799" data-file-height="535" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Neymar.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Neymar at a press conference for the <a href="/wiki/Brazil_national_football_team" title="Brazil national football team">Brazil national team</a> in August 2010. He made his international debut that month aged 18.</div></div></div>
<p>Following Neymar's performances for Santos in their successful early 2010 season, including winning the <a href="/wiki/2010_Copa_do_Brasil" title="2010 Copa do Brasil">2010 Copa do Brasil</a>, in which Neymar was the top goalscorer, and the <a href="/wiki/2010_Campeonato_Paulista" title="2010 Campeonato Paulista">2010 Campeonato Paulista</a>, in which Neymar scored 14 goals, former Brazilian football players <a href="/wiki/Pel%C3%A9" title="Pelé">Pelé</a> and <a href="/wiki/Rom%C3%A1rio" title="Romário">Romário</a> reportedly urged coach <a href="/wiki/Dunga" title="Dunga">Dunga</a> to take Neymar to the <a href="/wiki/2010_FIFA_World_Cup" title="2010 FIFA World Cup">2010 World Cup</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Brazilians_want_Neymar_35-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Brazilians_want_Neymar-35">&#91;34&#93;</a></sup> Although the widespread opinion that Neymar deserved a place in Dunga's squad went as far as a 14,000 signature petition,<sup id="cite_ref-Brazilians_want_Neymar_35-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Brazilians_want_Neymar-35">&#91;34&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-180" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-180">&#91;179&#93;</a></sup> and despite the huge pressure on Dunga to pick Neymar,<sup id="cite_ref-181" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-181">&#91;180&#93;</a></sup> he was omitted from both the squad of 23,<sup id="cite_ref-182" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-182">&#91;181&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-183" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-183">&#91;182&#93;</a></sup> and the stand-by list.<sup id="cite_ref-184" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-184">&#91;183&#93;</a></sup> Although Dunga described Neymar as "extremely talented", he claimed that he had not been tested sufficiently on the international level to earn a World Cup spot and he had failed to impress enough while on international duty.<sup id="cite_ref-185" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-185">&#91;184&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Andr%C3%A9_Santos,_Neymar_and_Ramires_celebrate_Neymars_goal.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3e/Andr%C3%A9_Santos%2C_Neymar_and_Ramires_celebrate_Neymars_goal.jpg/220px-Andr%C3%A9_Santos%2C_Neymar_and_Ramires_celebrate_Neymars_goal.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="147" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3e/Andr%C3%A9_Santos%2C_Neymar_and_Ramires_celebrate_Neymars_goal.jpg/330px-Andr%C3%A9_Santos%2C_Neymar_and_Ramires_celebrate_Neymars_goal.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3e/Andr%C3%A9_Santos%2C_Neymar_and_Ramires_celebrate_Neymars_goal.jpg/440px-Andr%C3%A9_Santos%2C_Neymar_and_Ramires_celebrate_Neymars_goal.jpg 2x" data-file-width="5184" data-file-height="3456" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Andr%C3%A9_Santos,_Neymar_and_Ramires_celebrate_Neymars_goal.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Neymar <a href="/wiki/Goal_celebration" title="Goal celebration">celebrates his goal</a> for <a href="/wiki/Brazil_national_football_team" title="Brazil national football team">Brazil</a> against <a href="/wiki/Scotland_national_football_team" title="Scotland national football team">Scotland</a>, on 27 March 2011, with <a href="/wiki/Andr%C3%A9_Santos" title="André Santos">André Santos</a> and <a href="/wiki/Ramires" title="Ramires">Ramires</a></div></div></div>
<p>On 26 July 2010, Neymar was selected for the first time in the <a href="/wiki/Brazil_national_football_team" title="Brazil national football team">Brazil senior team</a> by new head coach <a href="/wiki/Mano_Menezes" title="Mano Menezes">Mano Menezes</a> for a friendly match against the <a href="/wiki/United_States_men%27s_national_soccer_team" title="United States men&#39;s national soccer team">United States</a> to be played in <a href="/wiki/East_Rutherford,_New_Jersey" title="East Rutherford, New Jersey">East Rutherford, New Jersey</a>. On 10 August 2010 he made his debut with the national team in that game, aged 18 years old, starting the match and wearing the number 11 jersey. He scored on his debut after 28 minutes, a header coming from an <a href="/wiki/Andr%C3%A9_Santos" title="André Santos">André Santos</a> cross in a 2–0 win for Brazil.<sup id="cite_ref-186" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-186">&#91;185&#93;</a></sup> On 1 March 2011, Neymar said: "Being on the Brazilian team is a privilege, There are some marvelous players and I'm very happy to be among them."<sup id="cite_ref-Samba_Star_17-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Samba_Star-17">&#91;16&#93;</a></sup> On 27 March 2011, he scored twice in a 2–0 win against <a href="/wiki/Scotland_national_football_team" title="Scotland national football team">Scotland</a> at the <a href="/wiki/Emirates_Stadium" title="Emirates Stadium">Emirates Stadium</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-187" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-187">&#91;186&#93;</a></sup> During the match against <a href="/wiki/Scotland_national_football_team" title="Scotland national football team">Scotland</a>, a banana was thrown onto the pitch after he scored from the penalty spot, which led Neymar to complain about 'constant jeering and an atmosphere of racism', implying that Scottish fans exhibited racism.<sup id="cite_ref-188" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-188">&#91;187&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-189" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-189">&#91;188&#93;</a></sup> While Scottish officials explained that Neymar had been booed solely for perceived injury-feigning, a German student who was in the stadium amongst Brazil supporters said that he threw the banana with no racist intentions. This led to the <a href="/wiki/Scottish_Football_Association" title="Scottish Football Association">Scottish Football Association</a> asking the <a href="/wiki/Brazilian_Football_Confederation" title="Brazilian Football Confederation">Brazilian Football Confederation</a> for an apology for the accusations made to the Scottish fans.<sup id="cite_ref-190" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-190">&#91;189&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-191" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-191">&#91;190&#93;</a></sup> Neymar refused to apologise or retract his words, claiming he "did not accuse any person or any group of supporters".<sup id="cite_ref-192" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-192">&#91;191&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-193" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-193">&#91;192&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span id="2011_South_American_Youth_Championship_and_Copa_Am.C3.A9rica"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="2011_South_American_Youth_Championship_and_Copa_América">2011 South American Youth Championship and Copa América</span></h3>
<p>Neymar was the leading goal scorer of the <a href="/wiki/2011_South_American_Youth_Championship" class="mw-redirect" title="2011 South American Youth Championship">2011 South American Youth Championship</a> with nine goals, including two in the final, in Brazil's 6–0 win against Uruguay.<sup id="cite_ref-194" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-194">&#91;193&#93;</a></sup> He also took part at the <a href="/wiki/2011_Copa_Am%C3%A9rica" title="2011 Copa América">2011 Copa América</a> in <a href="/wiki/Argentina" title="Argentina">Argentina</a>, where he scored two goals in the first-round game against <a href="/wiki/Ecuador_national_football_team" title="Ecuador national football team">Ecuador</a>. He was selected 'Man of the Match' in Brazil's first match against <a href="/wiki/Venezuela_national_football_team" title="Venezuela national football team">Venezuela</a>, which ended a <a href="/wiki/2011_Copa_Am%C3%A9rica_Group_B#Brazil_v_Venezuela" title="2011 Copa América Group B">1–1</a> draw. Brazil were eliminated in the quarter-finals in a <a href="/wiki/Penalty_shoot-out_(association_football)" title="Penalty shoot-out (association football)">penalty shoot-out</a> against <a href="/wiki/Paraguay_national_football_team" title="Paraguay national football team">Paraguay</a> (2–2 <a href="/wiki/Overtime_(association_football)" class="mw-redirect" title="Overtime (association football)">a.e.t.</a>), with Neymar being substituted in the 80th minute.<sup id="cite_ref-195" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-195">&#91;194&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="2012_Summer_Olympics_and_first_hat-trick">2012 Summer Olympics and first hat-trick</span></h3>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Brazil_at_the_2012_Olympics.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/df/Brazil_at_the_2012_Olympics.jpg/220px-Brazil_at_the_2012_Olympics.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="165" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/df/Brazil_at_the_2012_Olympics.jpg/330px-Brazil_at_the_2012_Olympics.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/df/Brazil_at_the_2012_Olympics.jpg/440px-Brazil_at_the_2012_Olympics.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2816" data-file-height="2112" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Brazil_at_the_2012_Olympics.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Neymar preparing to take a free-kick against Belarus at <a href="/wiki/Old_Trafford" title="Old Trafford">Old Trafford</a> during the <a href="/wiki/2012_Summer_Olympics" title="2012 Summer Olympics">2012 Summer Olympics</a></div></div></div>
<p>On 11 May 2012, Neymar was selected for the squad of the <a href="/wiki/Brazil_Olympic_football_team" class="mw-redirect" title="Brazil Olympic football team">Brazil Olympic football team</a> to participate in the <a href="/wiki/London_2012_Olympic_Games" class="mw-redirect" title="London 2012 Olympic Games">London 2012 Olympic Games</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-196" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-196">&#91;195&#93;</a></sup>
In Brazil's first warm-up match on 20 July 2012, against the host nation <a href="/wiki/Great_Britain_national_football_team" class="mw-redirect" title="Great Britain national football team">Great Britain</a> at <a href="/wiki/Riverside_Stadium" title="Riverside Stadium">Riverside Stadium</a>, Neymar was involved in both goals of a 2–0 win, first making an assist with a free-kick into the six-yard box for <a href="/wiki/Sandro_(footballer,_born_1989)" title="Sandro (footballer, born 1989)">Sandro</a>'s header, before converting a penalty.<sup id="cite_ref-197" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-197">&#91;196&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>On 26 July 2012, Neymar scored his first goal of the 2012 Summer Olympics in Brazil's opening fixture against <a href="/wiki/Egypt_national_under-23_football_team" title="Egypt national under-23 football team">Egypt</a>, which ended a 3–2 victory for Brazil.<sup id="cite_ref-198" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-198">&#91;197&#93;</a></sup> In the following match against <a href="/wiki/Belarus_national_under-23_football_team" title="Belarus national under-23 football team">Belarus</a> at <a href="/wiki/Old_Trafford" title="Old Trafford">Old Trafford</a> in Manchester, Neymar scored a free-kick from 25-yards into the top-right corner of the goal and set up goals for <a href="/wiki/Alexandre_Pato" title="Alexandre Pato">Alexandre Pato</a>'s header with a cross from the right and <a href="/wiki/Oscar_(footballer,_born_1991)" title="Oscar (footballer, born 1991)">Oscar</a> with a back heel as Brazil secured their place in the quarter-finals with a 3–1 win. Afterwards he said: "I scored and made two assists so for me it was perfect".<sup id="cite_ref-199" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-199">&#91;198&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-200" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-200">&#91;199&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>On 5 August 2012, in the quarter-final encounter against <a href="/wiki/Honduras_national_under-23_football_team" title="Honduras national under-23 football team">Honduras</a>, Neymar scored a penalty, his third goal of the tournament and assisted in <a href="/wiki/Leandro_Dami%C3%A3o" title="Leandro Damião">Leandro Damião</a>'s second goal on the match, to help Brazil to a 3–2 victory at <a href="/wiki/St_James%27_Park" title="St James&#39; Park">St James' Park</a> and book a place in the semi-finals.<sup id="cite_ref-201" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-201">&#91;200&#93;</a></sup> On 11 August, Brazil lost 2–1 to <a href="/wiki/Mexico_national_under-23_football_team" title="Mexico national under-23 football team">Mexico</a> in the final at <a href="/wiki/Wembley_Stadium" title="Wembley Stadium">Wembley Stadium</a> in London.<sup id="cite_ref-202" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-202">&#91;201&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Neymar scored his first full international hat-trick on 10 September 2012, in an 8–0 win over <a href="/wiki/China_national_football_team" title="China national football team">China</a> at the <a href="/wiki/Est%C3%A1dio_Jos%C3%A9_do_Rego_Maciel" class="mw-redirect" title="Estádio José do Rego Maciel">Estádio José do Rego Maciel</a> in <a href="/wiki/Recife" title="Recife">Recife</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-203" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-203">&#91;202&#93;</a></sup> On 19 September, Neymar scored the winner against Argentina in a 2–1 win in the first leg of the <a href="/wiki/2012_Supercl%C3%A1sico_de_las_Am%C3%A9ricas" title="2012 Superclásico de las Américas">2012 Superclásico de las Américas</a> at the <a href="/wiki/Est%C3%A1dio_Serra_Dourada" title="Estádio Serra Dourada">Estádio Serra Dourada</a> in <a href="/wiki/Goi%C3%A2nia" title="Goiânia">Goiânia</a>, Brazil.<sup id="cite_ref-204" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-204">&#91;203&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="2013_Confederations_Cup">2013 Confederations Cup</span></h3>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Pique%26neymar.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3c/Pique%26neymar.jpg/220px-Pique%26neymar.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="204" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3c/Pique%26neymar.jpg/330px-Pique%26neymar.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3c/Pique%26neymar.jpg/440px-Pique%26neymar.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2784" data-file-height="2576" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Pique%26neymar.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Neymar playing against Spain's <a href="/wiki/Gerard_Piqu%C3%A9" title="Gerard Piqué">Gerard Piqué</a> in the <a href="/wiki/2013_FIFA_Confederations_Cup_Final" title="2013 FIFA Confederations Cup Final">2013 FIFA Confederations Cup Final</a></div></div></div>
<p>Neymar was selected as part of <a href="/wiki/Luiz_Felipe_Scolari" title="Luiz Felipe Scolari">Luiz Felipe Scolari</a>'s Brazil squad for the <a href="/wiki/2013_FIFA_Confederations_Cup" title="2013 FIFA Confederations Cup">2013 Confederations Cup</a> on home soil. For the tournament he was assigned the number 10 shirt, having previously worn 11.<sup id="cite_ref-205" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-205">&#91;204&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Neymar scored the first goal of the tournament in a 3–0 win over <a href="/wiki/Japan_national_football_team" title="Japan national football team">Japan</a> at the <a href="/wiki/Est%C3%A1dio_Nacional_Man%C3%A9_Garrincha" title="Estádio Nacional Mané Garrincha">Estádio Nacional Mané Garrincha</a> on 15 June.<sup id="cite_ref-206" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-206">&#91;205&#93;</a></sup> In their second match, Neymar scored after nine minutes and crossed for <a href="/wiki/J%C3%B4" title="Jô">Jô</a>'s late goal to give Brazil a 2–0 win over <a href="/wiki/Mexico_national_football_team" title="Mexico national football team">Mexico</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-207" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-207">&#91;206&#93;</a></sup> He scored in his third consecutive match, with a powerful free kick from the edge of the penalty area, as Brazil beat <a href="/wiki/Italy_national_football_team" title="Italy national football team">Italy</a> 4–2, and received his third consecutive man-of-the-match award.<sup id="cite_ref-208" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-208">&#91;207&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-209" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-209">&#91;208&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>On 30 June, Neymar was involved in <a href="/wiki/Fred_(footballer,_born_1983)" title="Fred (footballer, born 1983)">Fred</a>'s opening goal and then subsequently scored Brazil's second in the 3–0 <a href="/wiki/2013_FIFA_Confederations_Cup_Final" title="2013 FIFA Confederations Cup Final">final</a> victory over <a href="/wiki/Spain_national_football_team" title="Spain national football team">Spain</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Brazil_3–0_Spain_210-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Brazil_3–0_Spain-210">&#91;209&#93;</a></sup> Neymar's performances saw him receive the <a href="/wiki/Golden_Ball_(FIFA_Confederations_Cup)" class="mw-redirect" title="Golden Ball (FIFA Confederations Cup)">Golden Ball</a> for player of the tournament.<sup id="cite_ref-prosoccertalk.nbcsports.com_211-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-prosoccertalk.nbcsports.com-211">&#91;210&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="2014_World_Cup">2014 World Cup</span></h3>
<p>On 5 March 2014, Neymar scored a hat-trick in a friendly win against <a href="/wiki/South_Africa_national_football_team" title="South Africa national football team">South Africa</a> in <a href="/wiki/Johannesburg" title="Johannesburg">Johannesburg</a>. He made headlines for his conduct after the final whistle when a South African boy ran onto the pitch. As security staff began to escort the boy from the field, Neymar intervened and introduced him to his Brazil teammates before they lifted him in the air during their celebrations.<sup id="cite_ref-South_Africa_212-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-South_Africa-212">&#91;211&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-213" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-213">&#91;212&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r978413945/mw-parser-output/.tmulti"/><div class="thumb tmulti tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:214px;max-width:214px"><div class="trow"><div class="tsingle" style="width:212px;max-width:212px"><div class="thumbimage"><a href="/wiki/File:Brazil_and_Croatia_match_at_the_FIFA_World_Cup_2014-06-12_(02).jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/23/Brazil_and_Croatia_match_at_the_FIFA_World_Cup_2014-06-12_%2802%29.jpg/210px-Brazil_and_Croatia_match_at_the_FIFA_World_Cup_2014-06-12_%2802%29.jpg" decoding="async" width="210" height="141" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/23/Brazil_and_Croatia_match_at_the_FIFA_World_Cup_2014-06-12_%2802%29.jpg/315px-Brazil_and_Croatia_match_at_the_FIFA_World_Cup_2014-06-12_%2802%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/23/Brazil_and_Croatia_match_at_the_FIFA_World_Cup_2014-06-12_%2802%29.jpg/420px-Brazil_and_Croatia_match_at_the_FIFA_World_Cup_2014-06-12_%2802%29.jpg 2x" data-file-width="4901" data-file-height="3280" /></a></div><div class="thumbcaption">Neymar prepares to take a free kick during Brazil's opening match of the <a href="/wiki/2014_FIFA_World_Cup" title="2014 FIFA World Cup">2014 FIFA World Cup</a> against Croatia</div></div></div><div class="trow"><div class="tsingle" style="width:212px;max-width:212px"><div class="thumbimage"><a href="/wiki/File:Brazil_and_Mexico_match_at_the_FIFA_World_Cup_2014-06-17_(19).jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/83/Brazil_and_Mexico_match_at_the_FIFA_World_Cup_2014-06-17_%2819%29.jpg/210px-Brazil_and_Mexico_match_at_the_FIFA_World_Cup_2014-06-17_%2819%29.jpg" decoding="async" width="210" height="132" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/83/Brazil_and_Mexico_match_at_the_FIFA_World_Cup_2014-06-17_%2819%29.jpg/315px-Brazil_and_Mexico_match_at_the_FIFA_World_Cup_2014-06-17_%2819%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/8/83/Brazil_and_Mexico_match_at_the_FIFA_World_Cup_2014-06-17_%2819%29.jpg/420px-Brazil_and_Mexico_match_at_the_FIFA_World_Cup_2014-06-17_%2819%29.jpg 2x" data-file-width="5043" data-file-height="3172" /></a></div><div class="thumbcaption">Neymar evading a tackle against <a href="/wiki/Mexico_national_football_team" title="Mexico national football team">Mexico</a> at the 2014 World Cup</div></div></div></div></div>
<p>On 2 June, Neymar was named in the Brazil squad for the <a href="/wiki/2014_FIFA_World_Cup" title="2014 FIFA World Cup">2014 FIFA World Cup</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-214" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-214">&#91;213&#93;</a></sup> Going into the tournament, as the team's star player Neymar was expected to lead Brazil to their sixth World Cup success, and first title on home soil.<sup id="cite_ref-215" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-215">&#91;214&#93;</a></sup> One week prior to the team's opening match, Neymar scored once and made two assists in a 4–0 friendly win over <a href="/wiki/Panama_national_football_team" title="Panama national football team">Panama</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-216" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-216">&#91;215&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Neymar earned his 50th international cap in the opening match of the tournament, on 12 June against <a href="/wiki/Croatia_national_football_team" title="Croatia national football team">Croatia</a> in <a href="/wiki/S%C3%A3o_Paulo" title="São Paulo">São Paulo</a>. In the 26th minute, with Croatia leading 1–0, Neymar elbowed Croatian midfielder <a href="/wiki/Luka_Modri%C4%87" title="Luka Modri">Luka Modri</a>, after which Neymar was issued a <a href="/wiki/Yellow_card_(association_football)" class="mw-redirect" title="Yellow card (association football)">yellow card</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Squawka_News_Brazil_Croatia_217-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Squawka_News_Brazil_Croatia-217">&#91;216&#93;</a></sup> Many critics agreed that Neymar's punishment was too lenient and that he should have been issued a <a href="/wiki/Red_card_(association_football)" class="mw-redirect" title="Red card (association football)">red card</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Japanese_fans_regret_and_26th_minute_218-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Japanese_fans_regret_and_26th_minute-218">&#91;217&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Independent_Online_Brazil_Croatia_219-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Independent_Online_Brazil_Croatia-219">&#91;218&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Firstpost_Brazil_Croatia_220-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Firstpost_Brazil_Croatia-220">&#91;219&#93;</a></sup> He equalised before half-time with a shot from outside the box and gave Brazil the lead in the second half with a penalty kick, following a <a href="/wiki/List_of_2014_FIFA_World_Cup_controversies#Brazil_vs_Croatia" title="List of 2014 FIFA World Cup controversies">controversial decision</a> by the referee, in an eventual 3–1 win.<sup id="cite_ref-221" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-221">&#91;220&#93;</a></sup> In the third group match, he again scored twice as the <i>Seleção</i> defeated <a href="/wiki/Cameroon_national_football_team" title="Cameroon national football team">Cameroon</a> 4–1 to reach the <a href="/wiki/2014_FIFA_World_Cup_knockout_stage" title="2014 FIFA World Cup knockout stage">knockout stage</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-222" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-222">&#91;221&#93;</a></sup> In the <a href="/wiki/2014_FIFA_World_Cup_knockout_stage#Round_of_16" title="2014 FIFA World Cup knockout stage">round of 16</a> against <a href="/wiki/Chile_national_football_team" title="Chile national football team">Chile</a>, the match finished 1–1 after 120 minutes and was decided by a penalty shoot-out with Neymar scoring what proved to be the winning kick for Brazil.<sup id="cite_ref-beeb_223-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-beeb-223">&#91;222&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>In the <a href="/wiki/2014_FIFA_World_Cup_knockout_stage#Quarter-finals" title="2014 FIFA World Cup knockout stage">quarter-final</a> defeat of <a href="/wiki/Colombia_national_football_team" title="Colombia national football team">Colombia</a>, while challenging for the ball, Neymar was kneed in the back by <a href="/wiki/Juan_Camilo_Z%C3%BA%C3%B1iga" title="Juan Camilo Zúñiga">Juan Camilo Zúñiga</a> and had to be removed from the pitch on a stretcher. A hospital scan revealed that Neymar had suffered a <a href="/wiki/Spinal_fracture" title="Spinal fracture">fractured vertebra</a> in his spine and he missed the rest of the World Cup.<sup id="cite_ref-224" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-224">&#91;223&#93;</a></sup> Earlier in the match, Neymar assisted <a href="/wiki/Thiago_Silva" title="Thiago Silva">Thiago Silva</a>'s opening goal with a cross from a corner kick.<sup id="cite_ref-225" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-225">&#91;224&#93;</a></sup> It was the second Neymar assist from a corner in the tournament, after creating <a href="/wiki/David_Luiz" title="David Luiz">David Luiz</a>'s goal in the previous round against Chile.<sup id="cite_ref-beeb_223-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-beeb-223">&#91;222&#93;</a></sup> Without their injured talisman Neymar (and the suspended captain Thiago Silva), Brazil would ultimately lose in the semi-final in a stunning <a href="/wiki/Brazil_v_Germany_(2014_FIFA_World_Cup)" title="Brazil v Germany (2014 FIFA World Cup)">7–1 defeat to Germany</a> on 8 July.<sup id="cite_ref-226" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-226">&#91;225&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>On 11 July, Neymar was named on the 10-man shortlist for FIFA's <a href="/wiki/2014_FIFA_World_Cup#Golden_Ball" title="2014 FIFA World Cup">Golden Ball</a> award for the tournament's best player.<sup id="cite_ref-227" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-227">&#91;226&#93;</a></sup> He won the <a href="/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup_Golden_Shoe#Golden_Boot" class="mw-redirect" title="FIFA World Cup Golden Shoe">Bronze Boot</a> as the tournament's third top goalscorer and was named in the <a href="/wiki/FIFA_World_Cup_Golden_Shoe#All-Star_Team" class="mw-redirect" title="FIFA World Cup Golden Shoe">World Cup All Star XI</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-228" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-228">&#91;227&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span id="2015_Copa_Am.C3.A9rica"></span><span class="mw-headline" id="2015_Copa_América">2015 Copa América</span></h3>
<p>With captain <a href="/wiki/Thiago_Silva" title="Thiago Silva">Thiago Silva</a> ruled out through injury, new coach <a href="/wiki/Dunga" title="Dunga">Dunga</a> decided to make Neymar captain and confirmed on 5 September that the forward would stay on as skipper on a permanent basis.<sup id="cite_ref-229" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-229">&#91;228&#93;</a></sup> On 14 October 2014, Neymar scored four goals in one game for the first time in his international career, scoring all of Brazil's goals in 4–0 friendly win against Japan at the <a href="/wiki/National_Stadium,_Singapore" title="National Stadium, Singapore">National Stadium, Singapore</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Japan_230-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Japan-230">&#91;229&#93;</a></sup> At the age of just 22 years, Neymar had scored 40 goals in 58 internationals, and had become the <a href="/wiki/Brazil_national_football_team#Top_goalscorers" title="Brazil national football team">fifth highest goalscorer</a> for his national team.<sup id="cite_ref-Japan_230-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Japan-230">&#91;229&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-RSSSF_231-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-RSSSF-231">&#91;230&#93;</a></sup> On 26 March 2015, Neymar scored Brazil's second goal in a 3–1 friendly win over <a href="/wiki/France_national_football_team" title="France national football team">France</a> in Paris.<sup id="cite_ref-232" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-232">&#91;231&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>On 14 June 2015, in Brazil's opening <a href="/wiki/2015_Copa_Am%C3%A9rica" title="2015 Copa América">Copa América</a> fixture, Neymar scored the equaliser and assisted the stoppage-time winning goal by <a href="/wiki/Douglas_Costa" title="Douglas Costa">Douglas Costa</a> as Brazil came from 0–1 down to beat <a href="/wiki/Peru_national_football_team" title="Peru national football team">Peru</a> 2–1 in <a href="/wiki/Temuco" title="Temuco">Temuco</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-233" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-233">&#91;232&#93;</a></sup> After Brazil's second match, a 0–1 loss to <a href="/wiki/Colombia_national_football_team" title="Colombia national football team">Colombia</a> in <a href="/wiki/Santiago" title="Santiago">Santiago</a>, Neymar was booked for handball, resulting in a suspension. After the final whistle, he was <a href="/wiki/Ejection_(sports)" title="Ejection (sports)">red carded</a> for deliberately kicking the ball at <a href="/wiki/Pablo_Armero" title="Pablo Armero">Pablo Armero</a>, and as a result was pushed over by Colombian striker <a href="/wiki/Carlos_Bacca" title="Carlos Bacca">Carlos Bacca</a>, who was also dismissed.<sup id="cite_ref-234" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-234">&#91;233&#93;</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/CONMEBOL" title="CONMEBOL">CONMEBOL</a> issued Neymar with a four-match ban, ruling him out for the remainder of the tournament, in addition to a $10,000 fine.<sup id="cite_ref-235" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-235">&#91;234&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="2016_Summer_Olympics">2016 Summer Olympics</span></h3>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Brasil_conquista_primeiro_ouro_ol%C3%ADmpico_no_futebol_1039247-20082016-_mg_3424.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/7b/Brasil_conquista_primeiro_ouro_ol%C3%ADmpico_no_futebol_1039247-20082016-_mg_3424.jpg/220px-Brasil_conquista_primeiro_ouro_ol%C3%ADmpico_no_futebol_1039247-20082016-_mg_3424.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="147" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/7b/Brasil_conquista_primeiro_ouro_ol%C3%ADmpico_no_futebol_1039247-20082016-_mg_3424.jpg/330px-Brasil_conquista_primeiro_ouro_ol%C3%ADmpico_no_futebol_1039247-20082016-_mg_3424.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/7b/Brasil_conquista_primeiro_ouro_ol%C3%ADmpico_no_futebol_1039247-20082016-_mg_3424.jpg/440px-Brasil_conquista_primeiro_ouro_ol%C3%ADmpico_no_futebol_1039247-20082016-_mg_3424.jpg 2x" data-file-width="3800" data-file-height="2533" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Brasil_conquista_primeiro_ouro_ol%C3%ADmpico_no_futebol_1039247-20082016-_mg_3424.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Neymar preparing to strike the winning penalty kick for Brazil against Germany in the <a href="/wiki/Football_at_the_2016_Summer_Olympics_%E2%80%93_Men%27s_tournament#Gold_medal_match" title="Football at the 2016 Summer Olympics – Men&#39;s tournament">Olympic final</a></div></div></div>
<p>The CBF had wanted Neymar to play at the <a href="/wiki/Copa_Am%C3%A9rica_Centenario" title="Copa América Centenario">Copa América Centenario</a> and the <a href="/wiki/Football_at_the_2016_Summer_Olympics_%E2%80%93_Men%27s_tournament" title="Football at the 2016 Summer Olympics – Men&#39;s tournament">Olympics in Rio</a> during the summer of 2016, but after a request from Barcelona manager Luis Enrique, he was rested from the first tournament.<sup id="cite_ref-236" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-236">&#91;235&#93;</a></sup> In late June 2016, he was subsequently one of the three over-23 players to be included in <a href="/wiki/Football_at_the_2016_Summer_Olympics_%E2%80%93_Men%27s_team_squads#Brazil" title="Football at the 2016 Summer Olympics – Men&#39;s team squads">Brazil's squad for the 2016 Summer Olympics</a> on home soil, and was named the team's captain by the Olympic side's manager <a href="/wiki/Rog%C3%A9rio_Micale" title="Rogério Micale">Rogério Micale</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-237" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-237">&#91;236&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-238" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-238">&#91;237&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>In Brazil's quarter-final clash with <a href="/wiki/Colombia_Olympic_football_team" title="Colombia Olympic football team">Colombia</a> on 13 August, Neymar scored Brazil's first goal of the match, from a <a href="/wiki/Direct_free_kick" class="mw-redirect" title="Direct free kick">direct free kick</a>, and also set up his nation's second goal in an eventual 2–0 win.<sup id="cite_ref-239" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-239">&#91;238&#93;</a></sup> In Brazil's semi-final clash with <a href="/wiki/Honduras_national_under-23_football_team" title="Honduras national under-23 football team">Honduras</a> on 18 August, Neymar scored twice, Brazil's first and last goals of the match, in a 6–0 win.<sup id="cite_ref-240" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-240">&#91;239&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>In the final against Germany at the <a href="/wiki/Maracan%C3%A3_Stadium" title="Maracanã Stadium">Maracanã</a> in Rio on 20 August, Neymar opened the scoring with a free-kick after 27 minutes. The game finished 1–1 after <a href="/wiki/Max_Meyer_(footballer)" title="Max Meyer (footballer)">Max Meyer</a> equalised in the second-half. Brazil beat Germany 5–4 on penalties, and Neymar scored the winning penalty to bring Brazil its first Olympic gold medal in men's football.<sup id="cite_ref-241" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-241">&#91;240&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-242" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-242">&#91;241&#93;</a></sup> Both during and prior to the tournament, he had been subjected to criticism over his conduct on and off the pitch, with several former Brazil players suggesting that he was not fit to captain the national team.<sup id="cite_ref-243" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-243">&#91;242&#93;</a></sup> Neymar subsequently renounced the captaincy following their Olympic victory.<sup id="cite_ref-244" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-244">&#91;243&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="2018_World_Cup">2018 World Cup</span></h3>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Bra-Cos_(13).jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1d/Bra-Cos_%2813%29.jpg/220px-Bra-Cos_%2813%29.jpg" decoding="async" width="220" height="175" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1d/Bra-Cos_%2813%29.jpg/330px-Bra-Cos_%2813%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1d/Bra-Cos_%2813%29.jpg/440px-Bra-Cos_%2813%29.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1257" data-file-height="1000" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Bra-Cos_(13).jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Neymar <a href="/wiki/Goal_celebration" title="Goal celebration">celebrates scoring</a> against <a href="/wiki/Costa_Rica_national_football_team" title="Costa Rica national football team">Costa Rica</a> at the <a href="/wiki/2018_FIFA_World_Cup" title="2018 FIFA World Cup">2018 FIFA World Cup</a></div></div></div>
<p>In May 2018, Neymar was named in <a href="/wiki/Tite_(football_manager)" title="Tite (football manager)">Tite</a>'s final 23-man <a href="/wiki/Brazil_national_football_team" title="Brazil national football team">squad</a> for the <a href="/wiki/2018_FIFA_World_Cup" title="2018 FIFA World Cup">2018 World Cup</a> in Russia.<sup id="cite_ref-245" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-245">&#91;244&#93;</a></sup> On 3 June 2018, he made his international comeback after a three-month absence from a foot injury and scored a goal in a 2–0 win over <a href="/wiki/Croatia" title="Croatia">Croatia</a> in a friendly match at <a href="/wiki/Anfield" title="Anfield">Anfield</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-246" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-246">&#91;245&#93;</a></sup> The following week, he became Brazil's joint-third highest goalscorer alongside <a href="/wiki/Rom%C3%A1rio" title="Romário">Romário</a> when he scored his 55th international goal in a 3–0 friendly win over <a href="/wiki/Austria_national_football_team" title="Austria national football team">Austria</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-247" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-247">&#91;246&#93;</a></sup> In Brazil's second World Cup match, played against <a href="/wiki/Costa_Rica_national_football_team" title="Costa Rica national football team">Costa Rica</a> at the <a href="/wiki/Krestovsky_Stadium" title="Krestovsky Stadium">Krestovsky Stadium</a>, Saint Petersburg, on 22 June, Neymar scored the team's second goal in injury time as Brazil won 2–0.<sup id="cite_ref-248" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-248">&#91;247&#93;</a></sup> The goal, his 56th for Brazil, took him third in the all-time scoring chart behind only <a href="/wiki/Pel%C3%A9" title="Pelé">Pelé</a> and <a href="/wiki/Ronaldo_(Brazilian_footballer)" title="Ronaldo (Brazilian footballer)">Ronaldo</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-249" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-249">&#91;248&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>On 2 July, Neymar scored his second goal of the World Cup in a 2–0 win over Mexico in the last 16, while also assisting <a href="/wiki/Roberto_Firmino" title="Roberto Firmino">Roberto Firmino</a> for his goal.<sup id="cite_ref-250" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-250">&#91;249&#93;</a></sup> After the Mexico game, <a href="/wiki/BBC_Sport" title="BBC Sport">BBC Sport</a> wrote that despite Neymar's "good performances" coming up top in several statistics at the World Cup, "there is still a sense that he remains widely unpopular among neutrals" due to his "petulance and the play-acting". Meanwhile, Brazilian newspaper <i><a href="/wiki/O_Globo" title="O Globo">O Globo</a></i> wrote that "Neymar has charmed Brazil, but annoyed the whole world".<sup id="cite_ref-251" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-251">&#91;250&#93;</a></sup> On 6 July, Brazil were eliminated after losing 2–1 against <a href="/wiki/Belgium_national_football_team" title="Belgium national football team">Belgium</a> in the quarter-finals, with Neymar denied an injury time equaliser by a finger-tip save from Belgium goalkeeper <a href="/wiki/Thibaut_Courtois" title="Thibaut Courtois">Thibaut Courtois</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-252" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-252">&#91;251&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Lead_up_to_the_2022_World_Cup">Lead up to the 2022 World Cup</span></h3>
<p>In May 2019, Neymar was included in Brazil's 23-man squad for the <a href="/wiki/2019_Copa_Am%C3%A9rica" title="2019 Copa América">2019 Copa América</a> on home soil.<sup id="cite_ref-253" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-253">&#91;252&#93;</a></sup> On 5 June, however, he suffered an ankle injury in a 2–0 friendly win over <a href="/wiki/Qatar_national_football_team" title="Qatar national football team">Qatar</a> and was ruled out of the tournament, with Neymar expected to miss four weeks due to the injury.<sup id="cite_ref-254" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-254">&#91;253&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-255" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-255">&#91;254&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-256" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-256">&#91;255&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>On 10 October 2019, Neymar played his 100th match for Brazil in a friendly draw 1–1 with <a href="/wiki/Senegal_national_football_team" title="Senegal national football team">Senegal</a> in Singapore.<sup id="cite_ref-257" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-257">&#91;256&#93;</a></sup> On 13 October 2020, he scored a <a href="/wiki/Hat-trick#Association_football" title="Hat-trick">hat-trick</a> in a <a href="/wiki/2022_FIFA_World_Cup_qualification_(CONMEBOL)" title="2022 FIFA World Cup qualification (CONMEBOL)">2022 FIFA World Cup qualifier</a> against <a href="/wiki/Peru_national_football_team" title="Peru national football team">Peru</a>, which Brazil won 4–2. He reached his 64th international goal and surpassed <a href="/wiki/Ronaldo_(Brazilian_footballer)" title="Ronaldo (Brazilian footballer)">Ronaldo</a> as the nation's second highest goalscorer of all time.<sup id="cite_ref-258" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-258">&#91;257&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Player_profile">Player profile</span></h2>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Style_of_play_and_reception">Style of play and reception</span></h3>
<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:172px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Messi_with_Neymar_Junior_the_Future_of_Brazil.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3e/Messi_with_Neymar_Junior_the_Future_of_Brazil.jpg/170px-Messi_with_Neymar_Junior_the_Future_of_Brazil.jpg" decoding="async" width="170" height="162" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3e/Messi_with_Neymar_Junior_the_Future_of_Brazil.jpg/255px-Messi_with_Neymar_Junior_the_Future_of_Brazil.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/3e/Messi_with_Neymar_Junior_the_Future_of_Brazil.jpg/340px-Messi_with_Neymar_Junior_the_Future_of_Brazil.jpg 2x" data-file-width="3411" data-file-height="3241" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Messi_with_Neymar_Junior_the_Future_of_Brazil.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Neymar (right) greets future teammate <a href="/wiki/Lionel_Messi" title="Lionel Messi">Lionel Messi</a> after the <a href="/wiki/2011_FIFA_Club_World_Cup_Final" title="2011 FIFA Club World Cup Final">2011 FIFA Club World Cup Final</a>. As a teenager, Neymar was inspired by Messi.<sup id="cite_ref-259" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-259">&#91;258&#93;</a></sup></div></div></div>
<p>Neymar primarily plays as either a <a href="/wiki/Centre-forward" class="mw-redirect" title="Centre-forward">central striker</a>, <a href="/wiki/Second_striker" class="mw-redirect" title="Second striker">second striker</a>, <a href="/wiki/Winger_(association_football)" class="mw-redirect" title="Winger (association football)">winger</a> or occasionally as an <a href="/wiki/Attacking_midfielder" class="mw-redirect" title="Attacking midfielder">attacking midfielder</a>, and has been described as "a true phenomenon".<sup id="cite_ref-260" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-260">&#91;259&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-tuttomercatoweb.com_261-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-tuttomercatoweb.com-261">&#91;260&#93;</a></sup> He often plays as a left sided forward for both club and country in the team's 4–3–3 formation, drifting infield, due to his energetic pace and <a href="/wiki/Playmaker" title="Playmaker">playmaking</a> skills; this position allows him to shoot with his stronger foot, or <a href="/wiki/Assist_(football)" class="mw-redirect" title="Assist (football)">create chances for teammates</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-tuttomercatoweb.com_261-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-tuttomercatoweb.com-261">&#91;260&#93;</a></sup> Neymar's <a href="/wiki/Dribbling#Association_football" title="Dribbling">dribbling</a> skills, <a href="/wiki/Association_football_tactics_and_skills" title="Association football tactics and skills">tricks</a> and playmaking ability are reminiscent of compatriot <a href="/wiki/Ronaldinho" title="Ronaldinho">Ronaldinho</a>. His main traits are his creativity, vision, passing, finishing, dribbling, <a href="/wiki/Dummy_(football)#Association_football" title="Dummy (football)">feints</a>, touch, and technique, being described as both "electric" and "explosive".<sup id="cite_ref-262" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-262">&#91;261&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-263" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-263">&#91;262&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-264" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-264">&#91;263&#93;</a></sup> He is a notable exponent of the <a href="/wiki/Rainbow_flick" class="mw-redirect" title="Rainbow flick">rainbow flick</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-265" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-265">&#91;264&#93;</a></sup> A prolific goalscorer,<sup id="cite_ref-266" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-266">&#91;265&#93;</a></sup> although naturally right-footed, he is capable of scoring with both feet, as well as with his head, and is an accurate <a href="/wiki/Direct_free_kick" class="mw-redirect" title="Direct free kick">free-kick</a> and <a href="/wiki/Penalty_kick_(association_football)" title="Penalty kick (association football)">penalty</a> taker.<sup id="cite_ref-tuttomercatoweb.com_261-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-tuttomercatoweb.com-261">&#91;260&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-generazioneditalenti.it_267-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-generazioneditalenti.it-267">&#91;266&#93;</a></sup> Neymar stated: "I'm always trying to perfect everything – dribbling, shooting, headers and control. You can always improve".<sup id="cite_ref-Samba_Star_17-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Samba_Star-17">&#91;16&#93;</a></sup> He has been inspired by <a href="/wiki/Lionel_Messi" title="Lionel Messi">Lionel Messi</a>, <a href="/wiki/Cristiano_Ronaldo" title="Cristiano Ronaldo">Cristiano Ronaldo</a>, <a href="/wiki/Andr%C3%A9s_Iniesta" title="Andrés Iniesta">Andrés Iniesta</a>, <a href="/wiki/Xavi" title="Xavi">Xavi</a> and <a href="/wiki/Wayne_Rooney" title="Wayne Rooney">Wayne Rooney</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-268" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-268">&#91;267&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:172px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Neymar_2011.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1e/Neymar_2011.jpg/170px-Neymar_2011.jpg" decoding="async" width="170" height="253" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1e/Neymar_2011.jpg/255px-Neymar_2011.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1e/Neymar_2011.jpg/340px-Neymar_2011.jpg 2x" data-file-width="1832" data-file-height="2728" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Neymar_2011.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Neymar, playing for Brazil in 2011, has been compared to compatriots <a href="/wiki/Pel%C3%A9" title="Pelé">Pelé</a> and <a href="/wiki/Ronaldinho" title="Ronaldinho">Ronaldinho</a></div></div></div>
<p>Considered to be a highly promising player in his youth,<sup id="cite_ref-269" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-269">&#91;268&#93;</a></sup> Brazilian playmaker Ronaldinho had also tipped Neymar on becoming the best player in the world, stating in 2013: "Neymar is young though, and I can't explain how special he will become. In the next two or three seasons he will become the best player."<sup id="cite_ref-270" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-270">&#91;269&#93;</a></sup> Another Brazilian star, retired World Cup winner <a href="/wiki/Ronaldo_(Brazilian_footballer)" title="Ronaldo (Brazilian footballer)">Ronaldo</a> also believed that Neymar could become the best in the world, commenting: "Logically, Messi is better right now but Neymar is a great talent who will show the world that he will be number one".<sup id="cite_ref-271" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-271">&#91;270&#93;</a></sup> Former Real Madrid sporting director <a href="/wiki/Jorge_Valdano" title="Jorge Valdano">Jorge Valdano</a> has also praised Neymar, stating: "I like Neymar a lot. Many of his individual actions result in a goal and often it's a move that only seems to be happening with him on the pitch."<sup id="cite_ref-272" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-272">&#91;271&#93;</a></sup> After joining Barcelona, Neymar consequently established himself as one of the best players in world football.<sup id="cite_ref-273" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-273">&#91;272&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-274" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-274">&#91;273&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="quotebox pullquote floatleft" style="width:26%; ;"><link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1012376600"/>
<div class="quotebox-quote left-aligned" style="">"And so, circus Neymar arrived in Dortmund. The Brazilian’s moods, histrionics, petulance, and goalscoring prowess were on view in every fascinating and exasperating detail."</div>
<p><cite class="left-aligned" style="">—<i><a href="/wiki/Forbes" title="Forbes">Forbes</a></i> on some of the traits associated with Neymar following a Champions League game for PSG against Borussia Dortmund, February 2020.<sup id="cite_ref-275" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-275">&#91;274&#93;</a></sup></cite>
</p>
</div>
<p>However, Neymar also has been known and criticised for his excessive <a href="/wiki/Diving_(association_football)" title="Diving (association football)">diving</a><sup id="cite_ref-NYTimes2018_276-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-NYTimes2018-276">&#91;275&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Guardian2018_277-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Guardian2018-277">&#91;276&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-BleacherReport2018_278-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-BleacherReport2018-278">&#91;277&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-Deadspin2018_279-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Deadspin2018-279">&#91;278&#93;</a></sup> when tackled by another player for which Pelé has said, "[h]e is a player with a body that can't take a lot of hits. [...] A lot of times he will fall because he can't do anything else, but he was overdoing it." He continued: "Even when he is fouled, he can't make a spectacle out of it".<sup id="cite_ref-280" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-280">&#91;279&#93;</a></sup> During the 2018 World Cup, Neymar's antics inspired on social media the Neymar Challenge for dramatic dives.<sup id="cite_ref-281" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-281">&#91;280&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-282" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-282">&#91;281&#93;</a></sup> As the star player for Brazil (and PSG) he is often the most targeted player on the field; he was the most fouled player in Europe's top leagues in 2018.<sup id="cite_ref-283" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-283">&#91;282&#93;</a></sup> A divisive figure in world football, he has been accused of exaggerating injury, with <a href="/wiki/Eric_Cantona" title="Eric Cantona">Eric Cantona</a> stating Neymar is a "great actor", comparing him to a wheeled suitcase: "you barely touch it, and it turns round and round for hours."<sup id="cite_ref-284" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-284">&#91;283&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-285" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-285">&#91;284&#93;</a></sup> In response to the criticism over his petulance and histrionics, Neymar starred in a post 2018 World Cup commercial where he admitted to not being able to deal with his frustrations which contributed to theatrics while on the pitch and promised to change for the better.<sup id="cite_ref-286" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-286">&#91;285&#93;</a></sup> He has also struggled with injuries throughout his career.<sup id="cite_ref-287" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-287">&#91;286&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Comparisons">Comparisons</span></h3>
<p>The media have often drawn comparisons between Neymar and Brazilian legend <a href="/wiki/Pel%C3%A9" title="Pelé">Pelé</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-generazioneditalenti.it_267-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-generazioneditalenti.it-267">&#91;266&#93;</a></sup> as Neymar possesses similar attributes and also like Pelé came from the Santos Youth Academy and turned heads with his skill. Neymar has said that Pelé is his "role model" but also saying: "I don't like to make a comparison with Pelé".<sup id="cite_ref-288" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-288">&#91;287&#93;</a></sup> He has also been compared to compatriot <a href="/wiki/Ronaldinho" title="Ronaldinho">Ronaldinho</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-289" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-289">&#91;288&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Neymar's increasing reputation led both the media and former great players to draw comparisons between Neymar and Barcelona forward Lionel Messi, which Neymar has commented on saying: "Messi is above everyone, there is no use comparing me with him. He is the best player in the world and I always get inspired when I watch good football."<sup id="cite_ref-290" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-290">&#91;289&#93;</a></sup> Ronaldo stated: "Neymar is a great talent, the best we have in Brazil. He is very similar to Messi." <a href="/wiki/Zico_(footballer)" title="Zico (footballer)">Zico</a> said: "I see Neymar like a [Cristiano] Ronaldo or a Messi, the type who appears and makes things happen."<sup id="cite_ref-291" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-291">&#91;290&#93;</a></sup> After his hat-trick in a 3–1 victory against Internacional in the Copa Libertadores and Messi's five goals scored in the Champions League, Neymar said: "I am a Messi fan. I was told what he did today. I support him to score a lot of nice goals so I can keep copying and imitating him."<sup id="cite_ref-292" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-292">&#91;291&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-293" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-293">&#91;292&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Outside_football">Outside football</span></h2>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Personal_life">Personal life</span></h3>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:172px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Brasil_conquista_primeiro_ouro_ol%C3%ADmpico_nos_penaltis_1039248-20082016-_mg_0015cropped.jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/22/Brasil_conquista_primeiro_ouro_ol%C3%ADmpico_nos_penaltis_1039248-20082016-_mg_0015cropped.jpg/170px-Brasil_conquista_primeiro_ouro_ol%C3%ADmpico_nos_penaltis_1039248-20082016-_mg_0015cropped.jpg" decoding="async" width="170" height="255" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/22/Brasil_conquista_primeiro_ouro_ol%C3%ADmpico_nos_penaltis_1039248-20082016-_mg_0015cropped.jpg/255px-Brasil_conquista_primeiro_ouro_ol%C3%ADmpico_nos_penaltis_1039248-20082016-_mg_0015cropped.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/2/22/Brasil_conquista_primeiro_ouro_ol%C3%ADmpico_nos_penaltis_1039248-20082016-_mg_0015cropped.jpg/340px-Brasil_conquista_primeiro_ouro_ol%C3%ADmpico_nos_penaltis_1039248-20082016-_mg_0015cropped.jpg 2x" data-file-width="533" data-file-height="800" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Brasil_conquista_primeiro_ouro_ol%C3%ADmpico_nos_penaltis_1039248-20082016-_mg_0015cropped.jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Neymar expresses his Christian faith after winning the gold medal with <a href="/wiki/Brazil_national_under-23_football_team" title="Brazil national under-23 football team">Brazil</a> at the <a href="/wiki/2016_Summer_Olympics" title="2016 Summer Olympics">2016 Summer Olympics</a></div></div></div>
<p>Neymar has a son, Davi Lucca, born on 13 August 2011, with former girlfriend Carolina Dantas.<sup id="cite_ref-294" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-294">&#91;293&#93;</a></sup> He has a very close <a href="/wiki/Sibling_relationship" title="Sibling relationship">sibling relationship</a> with his sister Rafaella Beckran, and cemented this <a href="/wiki/Platonic_love" title="Platonic love">platonic</a> closeness by tattooing her face on his arm, while Beckran tattooed her brother's eyes on her arm.<sup id="cite_ref-295" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-295">&#91;294&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Neymar is a <a href="/wiki/Christianity" title="Christianity">Christian</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-296" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-296">&#91;295&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-297" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-297">&#91;296&#93;</a></sup> and follows the <a href="/wiki/Pentecostalism" title="Pentecostalism">Pentecostal</a> branch of the religion.<sup id="cite_ref-298" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-298">&#91;297&#93;</a></sup> Neymar has spoken about his faith saying: "Life only makes sense when our highest ideal is to serve <a href="/wiki/Jesus" title="Jesus">Christ</a>!"<sup id="cite_ref-299" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-299">&#91;298&#93;</a></sup> Additionally, he has sometimes worn a headband with the words "100% Jesus".<sup id="cite_ref-300" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-300">&#91;299&#93;</a></sup>
Neymar reportedly also <a href="/wiki/Tithe" title="Tithe">tithes</a> (10%) his income to his church and has named <a href="/wiki/Kak%C3%A1" title="Kaká">Kaká</a> as his religious role model.<sup id="cite_ref-301" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-301">&#91;300&#93;</a></sup> Each year, Neymar organises a charity match with fellow Brazilian footballer <a href="/wiki/Nen%C3%AA_(footballer,_born_1981)" title="Nenê (footballer, born 1981)">Nenê</a> in Nenê's hometown of <a href="/wiki/Jundia%C3%AD" title="Jundiaí">Jundiaí</a>, with the purpose of raising food for needy families.<sup id="cite_ref-302" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-302">&#91;301&#93;</a></sup> In addition to his native <a href="/wiki/Portuguese_language" title="Portuguese language">Portuguese</a>, Neymar also speaks Spanish.<sup id="cite_ref-303" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-303">&#91;302&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-304" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-304">&#91;303&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>In July 2019, police announced that a rape investigation against Neymar would be dropped due to insufficient evidence.<sup id="cite_ref-305" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-305">&#91;304&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>On 2 September 2020, it was reported that Neymar, along with PSG teammates <a href="/wiki/%C3%81ngel_Di_Mar%C3%ADa" title="Ángel Di María">Ángel Di María</a> and <a href="/wiki/Leandro_Paredes" title="Leandro Paredes">Leandro Paredes</a>, tested positive for <a href="/wiki/Coronavirus_disease_2019" class="mw-redirect" title="Coronavirus disease 2019">COVID-19</a>. The French sports newspaper <i><a href="/wiki/L%27%C3%89quipe" title="L&#39;Équipe">L'Équipe</a></i> said that the three players reportedly went on vacation in <a href="/wiki/Ibiza" title="Ibiza">Ibiza</a>. As a result, they were quarantined for one week, and the rest of the players and working staff were scheduled to take a coronavirus test within the same week.<sup id="cite_ref-306" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-306">&#91;305&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-307" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-307">&#91;306&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Wealth_and_sponsorships">Wealth and sponsorships</span></h3>
<p>Neymar has signed many sponsorship deals since his reputation began to grow from the age of 17. In March 2011, he signed an 11-year contract with American sportswear company <a href="/wiki/Nike,_Inc." title="Nike, Inc.">Nike</a>,<sup id="cite_ref-308" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-308">&#91;307&#93;</a></sup> which ended in August 2020.<sup id="cite_ref-309" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-309">&#91;308&#93;</a></sup> Neymar has since signed with German sportswear company <a href="/wiki/Puma_(brand)" title="Puma (brand)">Puma</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-310" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-310">&#91;309&#93;</a></sup> Still in March 2011, <a href="/wiki/Panasonic" title="Panasonic">Panasonic</a> paid US$2.4&#160;million to secure Neymar's services for two years. Prior to signing for Barcelona, <i><a href="/wiki/France_Football" title="France Football">France Football</a></i> had ranked Neymar 13th in its list of the world's richest players in 2012, with total earnings of $18.8&#160;million for the previous 12 months.<sup id="cite_ref-311" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-311">&#91;310&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-312" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-312">&#91;311&#93;</a></sup> He has also signed other sponsorships from <a href="/wiki/Volkswagen" title="Volkswagen">Volkswagen</a>, Tenys Pé Baruel, Lupo, <a href="/wiki/Ambev" title="Ambev">Ambev</a>, <a href="/wiki/Claro_Americas" class="mw-redirect" title="Claro Americas">Claro</a>, <a href="/wiki/Unilever" title="Unilever">Unilever</a> and <a href="/wiki/Santander_Group" class="mw-redirect" title="Santander Group">Santander</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-313" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-313">&#91;312&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-314" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-314">&#91;313&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-315" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-315">&#91;314&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-316" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-316">&#91;315&#93;</a></sup> By 2018, <i>France Football</i> ranked Neymar the third highest paid footballer in the world, earning €81.5m ($95m) for a calendar year in combined income from salaries, bonuses and endorsements deals.<sup id="cite_ref-:1_317-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-:1-317">&#91;316&#93;</a></sup> In 2019, <i><a href="/wiki/Forbes" title="Forbes">Forbes</a></i> ranked Neymar the <a href="/wiki/Forbes%27_list_of_the_world%27s_highest-paid_athletes" title="Forbes&#39; list of the world&#39;s highest-paid athletes">world's third highest-paid athlete</a> (after Lionel Messi and Cristiano Ronaldo) with earnings of $105 million for the calendar year.<sup id="cite_ref-Forbes_14-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Forbes-14">&#91;13&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>On 8 May 2013, Neymar was rated by <i><a href="/wiki/SportsPro" title="SportsPro">SportsPro</a></i> magazine as the most marketable athlete in the world, ahead of Lionel Messi (2nd) and Cristiano Ronaldo (8th).<sup id="cite_ref-318" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-318">&#91;317&#93;</a></sup> The same month, Neymar launched the <a href="/wiki/Nike_Hypervenom" title="Nike Hypervenom">Nike Hypervenom</a> football boot.<sup id="cite_ref-319" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-319">&#91;318&#93;</a></sup> In November 2012 advertising agency Loducca, created Neymar's own personal brand logo,<sup id="cite_ref-brand_320-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-brand-320">&#91;319&#93;</a></sup> featuring the N, J and R (Neymar Junior) with the N styled to match Neymar's shirt number 11.<sup id="cite_ref-brand_320-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-brand-320">&#91;319&#93;</a></sup> Neymar starred in a 2014 advert for <a href="/wiki/Beats_Electronics" title="Beats Electronics">Beats</a> with other global football stars including <a href="/wiki/Thierry_Henry" title="Thierry Henry">Thierry Henry</a> and <a href="/wiki/Luis_Su%C3%A1rez" title="Luis Suárez">Luis Suárez</a>, with the theme of 'The Game Before The Game' and the players pre-game ritual of listening to music.<sup id="cite_ref-321" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-321">&#91;320&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Media">Media</span></h3>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:172px;"><a href="/wiki/File:Neymar_visiting_Red_Bull_Arena_(cropped).jpg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/91/Neymar_visiting_Red_Bull_Arena_%28cropped%29.jpg/170px-Neymar_visiting_Red_Bull_Arena_%28cropped%29.jpg" decoding="async" width="170" height="226" class="thumbimage" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/91/Neymar_visiting_Red_Bull_Arena_%28cropped%29.jpg/255px-Neymar_visiting_Red_Bull_Arena_%28cropped%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/91/Neymar_visiting_Red_Bull_Arena_%28cropped%29.jpg/340px-Neymar_visiting_Red_Bull_Arena_%28cropped%29.jpg 2x" data-file-width="2104" data-file-height="2802" /></a>  <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a href="/wiki/File:Neymar_visiting_Red_Bull_Arena_(cropped).jpg" class="internal" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Neymar at the <a href="/wiki/Red_Bull_Arena_(New_Jersey)" title="Red Bull Arena (New Jersey)">Red Bull Arena</a> in <a href="/wiki/Harrison,_New_Jersey" title="Harrison, New Jersey">Harrison, New Jersey</a> during a match between <a href="/wiki/New_York_Red_Bulls" title="New York Red Bulls">New York Red Bulls</a> and <a href="/wiki/LA_Galaxy" title="LA Galaxy">LA Galaxy</a> in 2011</div></div></div>
<p>Neymar was featured on the front covers of the video games <i><a href="/wiki/Pro_Evolution_Soccer_2012" title="Pro Evolution Soccer 2012">Pro Evolution Soccer 2012</a></i> and <i><a href="/wiki/Pro_Evolution_Soccer_2013" title="Pro Evolution Soccer 2013">Pro Evolution Soccer 2013</a></i> on the North American version, after <a href="/wiki/Konami" title="Konami">Konami</a> Digital Entertainment announced that he had joined Pro Evolution Soccer.<sup id="cite_ref-322" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-322">&#91;321&#93;</a></sup> Neymar joined <a href="/wiki/Cristiano_Ronaldo" title="Cristiano Ronaldo">Cristiano Ronaldo</a> as a featured cover athlete.<sup id="cite_ref-323" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-323">&#91;322&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-324" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-324">&#91;323&#93;</a></sup> Neymar also features in <a href="/wiki/EA_Sports" title="EA Sports">EA Sports</a>' <a href="/wiki/FIFA_(video_game_series)" title="FIFA (video game series)"><i>FIFA</i> video game series</a>, with the trailer for <i><a href="/wiki/FIFA_18" title="FIFA 18">FIFA 18</a></i> showing him in his PSG home jersey.<sup id="cite_ref-325" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-325">&#91;324&#93;</a></sup> He appears alongside Cristiano Ronaldo on the Champions and Ultimate Edition packs for <i><a href="/wiki/FIFA_19" title="FIFA 19">FIFA 19</a></i>, where Neymar's "Hang Loose" <a href="/wiki/Goal_celebration" title="Goal celebration">goal celebration</a> also features in the game.<sup id="cite_ref-326" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-326">&#91;325&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-327" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-327">&#91;326&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Neymar appeared on the cover of <i><a href="/wiki/TIME_(magazine)" class="mw-redirect" title="TIME (magazine)">Time</a></i> magazine in February 2013, the first Brazilian athlete to do so. The issue included an article by <a href="/wiki/Bobby_Ghosh" title="Bobby Ghosh">Bobby Ghosh</a> entitled "The Next Pelé" and subtitled "How the career of Brazilian football star Neymar explains his country's economy".<sup id="cite_ref-328" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-328">&#91;327&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>Controversy erupted because of a cover by Brazilian football magazine <i><a href="/wiki/Placar" title="Placar">Placar</a></i> that depicted Neymar on a cross. The title read "A Crucificação de Neymar" (the Crucifixion of Neymar) and subtitled: "the Brazilian ace turns scapegoat in a sport where everyone plays dirty".<sup id="cite_ref-329" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-329">&#91;328&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>In April 2013, Brazilian cartoonist <a href="/wiki/Mauricio_de_Sousa" title="Mauricio de Sousa">Mauricio de Sousa</a> released a <i><a href="/wiki/Monica%27s_Gang" title="Monica&#39;s Gang">Monica's Gang</a></i> comic book featuring a younger version of Neymar (called <i>Neymar Jr.</i>) as the main character.<sup id="cite_ref-330" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-330">&#91;329&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>In May 2013, <i>SportsPro</i> magazine named Neymar as the most marketable athlete on the planet for the second consecutive year. He topped the list ahead of <a href="/wiki/Lionel_Messi" title="Lionel Messi">Lionel Messi</a>, <a href="/wiki/Rory_McIlroy" title="Rory McIlroy">Rory McIlroy</a>, <a href="/wiki/Usain_Bolt" title="Usain Bolt">Usain Bolt</a> and Cristiano Ronaldo, among other sportspeople.<sup id="cite_ref-SportsPro_331-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-SportsPro-331">&#91;330&#93;</a></sup> The list measures the monetary value, the age, the force in domestic markets, the charisma and their market potential in the next three years.<sup id="cite_ref-SportsPro_331-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-SportsPro-331">&#91;330&#93;</a></sup> In March 2015, Neymar had the fourth highest social media rank in the world among sportspeople, behind Cristiano Ronaldo, Lionel Messi and David Beckham, with 52 million Facebook fans.<sup id="cite_ref-332" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-332">&#91;331&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-333" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-333">&#91;332&#93;</a></sup> He has <a href="/wiki/List_of_most-followed_Instagram_accounts" title="List of most-followed Instagram accounts">over 140 million Instagram followers</a>, the third highest for a sportsperson (after Cristiano Ronaldo and Messi), and inside the top 10 most followed people.<sup id="cite_ref-334" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-334">&#91;333&#93;</a></sup> In <a href="/wiki/ESPN" title="ESPN">ESPN</a>'s list of active sportspeople in 2016, Neymar was ranked the fourth most famous athlete in the world.<sup id="cite_ref-ESPN_100_335-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-ESPN_100-335">&#91;334&#93;</a></sup> In April 2017, Neymar was included in the <a href="/wiki/Time_100" title="Time 100">Time 100</a>, <i>Time</i> magazine's list of the most influential people in the world.<sup id="cite_ref-:0_13-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-:0-13">&#91;12&#93;</a></sup> In 2019, ESPN again ranked him the world's fourth most famous athlete.<sup id="cite_ref-336" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-336">&#91;335&#93;</a></sup>
</p><p>To mark the <a href="/wiki/2014_FIFA_World_Cup" title="2014 FIFA World Cup">World Cup</a> commencing in Brazil, in June 2014, Neymar appeared with supermodel <a href="/wiki/Gisele_B%C3%BCndchen" title="Gisele Bündchen">Gisele Bündchen</a> on the front cover of <a href="/wiki/Vogue_(magazine)" title="Vogue (magazine)"><i>Vogue</i></a>'s Brazilian edition.<sup id="cite_ref-337" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-337">&#91;336&#93;</a></sup> In November 2014, Neymar appeared in FIFA's "11 against <a href="/wiki/Ebola_virus_disease" class="mw-redirect" title="Ebola virus disease">Ebola</a>" campaign with a selection of top football players from around the world, including Cristiano Ronaldo, <a href="/wiki/Gareth_Bale" title="Gareth Bale">Gareth Bale</a>, <a href="/wiki/Xavi" title="Xavi">Xavi</a> and <a href="/wiki/Didier_Drogba" title="Didier Drogba">Didier Drogba</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-Ebola_338-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Ebola-338">&#91;337&#93;</a></sup> Under the slogan "Together, we can beat Ebola", FIFA's campaign was done in conjunction with the <a href="/wiki/Confederation_of_African_Football" title="Confederation of African Football">Confederation of African Football</a> and health experts, with the players holding up eleven messages to raise awareness of the disease and ways to combat it.<sup id="cite_ref-Ebola_338-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-Ebola-338">&#91;337&#93;</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-339" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-339">&#91;338&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Music">Music</span></h3>
<p>Neymar has become an icon in promoting Brazilian modern pop music, particularly <a href="/wiki/M%C3%BAsica_sertaneja" title="Música sertaneja">Música sertaneja</a>. The video in which Neymar dances in the <a href="/wiki/Santos_FC" title="Santos FC">Santos</a> <a href="/wiki/Locker_room" class="mw-redirect" title="Locker room">locker room</a> dancing in front of teammates carrying his recorder making the round of the players and making them react to the tune of <a href="/wiki/Michel_Tel%C3%B3" title="Michel Teló">Michel Teló</a>'s hit "<a href="/wiki/Ai_se_eu_te_pego!" class="mw-redirect" title="Ai se eu te pego!">Ai se eu te pego!</a>" went <a href="/wiki/Viral_video" title="Viral video">viral</a>. He made a point of performing his dance antics to the song after scoring goals in football games and appeared live with Teló in one of the latter's concerts. He also supported sertanejo singer <a href="/wiki/Gusttavo_Lima" title="Gusttavo Lima">Gusttavo Lima</a> performing live with Lima on renditions of the singer's hits "<a href="/wiki/Balada_(song)" title="Balada (song)">Balada</a>" and "Fazer Beber". In 2012, he made cameo appearances in the <a href="/wiki/Music_video" title="Music video">music video</a> for yet another sertanejo hit "<a href="/wiki/Eu_Quero_Tchu,_Eu_Quero_Tcha" title="Eu Quero Tchu, Eu Quero Tcha">Eu Quero Tchu, Eu Quero Tcha</a>" by <a href="/wiki/Jo%C3%A3o_Lucas_%26_Marcelo" title="João Lucas &amp; Marcelo">João Lucas &amp; Marcelo</a>. In 2013, Neymar appeared on a rap music video, "País do Futebol" by <a href="/wiki/MC_Guim%C3%AA" title="MC Guimê">MC Guimê</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-340" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-340">&#91;339&#93;</a></sup>
</p>
